data.job_description:
About Pearson VUE

At Pearson VUE (www.pearsonVUE.com), we believe learning takes us from potential to progress. That is why we deliver high-stakes exams that help industries and individuals make an impact on their professions, communities, and the lives of others. Our customers’ high-stakes certification, licensure, admissions, and other credentialing exams help people advance in technology, government, and professional careers, as well as attain educational growth. Pearson VUE offers proctored exams through the world's largest network of test centers in addition to testing in online and un proctored environments. Our Products and Technology team powers our business to deliver over 19 million exams annually at 20,000 test centers in 188 countries.

Pearson VUE is a business of Pearson, the world's leading learning company with global-reach and market-leading businesses. Pearson is listed on both the London and New York stock exchanges (UK: PSON; NYSE: PSO). For more information, visit www.pearson.com. As a global business, we understand the critical link between technology and business strategy and integrate them closely to help people succeed in their lifetime of learning. From leadership to stable teams, we foster collaboration and teamwork towards building a collective “we” culture in everything.

Summary

As a Software Engineering Manager, you will have the opportunity to provide tactical, strategic, and technical leadership for a software engineering group that supports a critical business domain. In this role, you will support the development of software systems through stable teams including Architects, Developers, Business Analysts, and Quality Engineers. You will do this by coordinating and managing the daily activities of group members in assigned work areas and resolving day-to-day issues, workflow, and business issues. You are also expected to apply industry experience, processes, and tools to improve team operations and to build and maintain a supportive, cooperative, and cohesive work environment. As a Software Engineering Manager, you will regularly coordinate with other functional teams, as well as disciplines like Product Strategy, Product Management and Program Management. You will also represent the team’s work with important internal stakeholder groups, working with them to understand their needs and resolve their issues through the following core responsibilities.

The Product:

This position will own and support the Athena Browser Edition (ABE) suite of applications within the Test Authoring, Publishing & Delivery department. ABE is Pearson VUE’s next generation strategic test driver responsible for exam presentation to candidates, recording of candidate responses, calculation of exam scores and reporting of exam results. We are in the midst of building out the ABE suite of applications, which leverage state of the art technologies and processes. With strong organizational support and momentum, we are looking for an outstanding candidate to bolster the technical staff for this mission critical suite of applications.

Product Delivery
• Represent team capacity and work with the business to schedule prioritized projects
• Understand the product and solution space and ensure Pearson VUE maintains best-in-class
• Suggest and lead process and technology improvements within the technology team
• Ensure diversity within the engineering roadmap between internal engineering needs (e.g., technical debt, security), client needs and roadmap items
• Manage resource requirements and formulate strategies to meet stakeholder needs
• Engage with other teams to ensure successful coordination of project dependencies
• Collaborate with Project Managers to drive work to successful completion
• Manage Critical Incident response efforts with client needs first and foremost
• Ensure each product release meet Pearson VUE quality thresholds

People Management:
• Provide one on one coaching and direction for team members
• Set goals and provide feedback for team member’s performance reviews
• Provide responsible management of compensation plans for staff
• Recruit and retain high performing staff with skills that meet the team’s needs
• Manage partnerships with consulting firms to supplement engineering teams as necessary
• Promote a culture of continuous improvement within your team and the larger organization

Technology Leadership:
• Understand and manage the various technologies leveraged in application suites
• Collaborate with architects and directors on strategic direction and drive that direction to completion
• Represent technical issues to product stakeholders and clients
• Identify areas for technical improvement and create plans to address
• Provide leadership around agile development processes and emerging trends in engineering best practices
• Minimize technical debt by balancing maintenance and feature work as necessary
• Current Toolset: Java, JavaScript, Angular, Spring/Spring Boot, Docker, RabbitMQ, MariaDB

Communications:
• Collaborate with product stakeholders regarding roadmap and releases
• Promote organizational goals and values to your team
• Represent Pearson VUE in current and potential client engagements

Required Education and Experience:
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business or other application field or equivalent experience
• 7+ years in software development and demonstrated ability to lead and manage teams towards high performance
• 4+ years in technical leadership with relevant experience on Java based applications
• At least 2-3 years in a direct management role or other related background consistent with success in this role.

Desired Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
• Ability to work well through ambiguity and make tough decisions
• Agility in leadership to take on challenges with growing business needs
• Strong interpersonal, communication and presentation skills
• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
• Passion for agile software development and continuous improvement

Pearson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and a member of E-Verify. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. All employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business need. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other group protected by law.

Compensation at Pearson is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. As required by the Colorado and New York City laws, the pay range for this position is as follows:

Minimum full-time salary range is between $135,000 - $155,000.

This position is eligible to participate in an annual incentive program, and information on benefits offered is here here.

ABOUT US

Learning is the most powerful force for change in the world. More than 20,000 Pearson employees deliver our products and services in nearly 200 countries, all working towards a common purpose – to help everyone achieve their potential through learning. We do that by providing high quality, digital content and learning experiences, as well as assessments and qualifications that help people build their skills and grow with the world around them. We are the world’s leading learning company. Learn more at pearsonplc.com.

Pearson believes that wherever learning flourishes, so do people. We are committed to being an anti-racist company in everything we do. We value the power of an inclusive culture and a strong sense of belonging. We promote a culture where differences are embraced, opportunities are accessible, consideration and respect are the norm, and all individuals are supported in reaching their full potential. Through our talent, we believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion make us a more innovative and vibrant place to work. People are at the center, and we are committed to a sustainable environment and workplace where talent can learn, grow, and thrive.  

To learn more about Pearson’s commitment to a diverse and inclusive workforce, please click here:  http://www.pearson.com/careers/diversity-and-inclusion.html

#LI-POST

What to expect from Pearson

Did you know Pearson is one of the 10 most innovative education companies of 2022?

At Pearson, we add life to a lifetime of learning so everyone can realize the life they imagine. We do this by creating vibrant and enriching learning experiences designed for real-life impact. We are on a journey to be 100 percent digital to meet the changing needs of the global population by developing a new strategy with ambitious targets. To deliver on our strategic vision, we have five business divisions that are the foundation for the long-term growth of the company: Assessment & Qualifications, Virtual Learning, English Language Learning, Workforce Skills and Higher Education. Alongside these, we have our corporate divisions: Digital & Technology, Finance, Global Corporate Marketing & Communications, Human Resources, Legal, Strategy and Direct to Consumer. Learn more at We are Pearson.

We value the power of an inclusive culture and also a strong sense of belonging. We promote a culture where differences are embraced, opportunities are accessible, consideration and respect are the norm and all individuals are supported in reaching their full potential. Through our talent, we believe that diversity, equity and inclusion make us a more innovative and vibrant place to work. You will be the face of the engagement internally and externally. Internally the role will involve working closely with our onshore/offshore scrum teams and engineering managers as well as our practices and COE? s to elevate the team to the next level. Externally you will be a partner to the Engineering VPs, Directors and managers to guide them and our team together on this journey.

Good to have skills
• Experience within the Automobile industry, specifically around dealers and lenders is a good to have.
• Technical certification on AWS and SAFe will be a bonus.

Job Description

At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.

The Boeing Defense, Space and Security (BDS), Ground Development and Mission Operations Division, is seeking a Senior Ground Engineering Manager (Level M) to join our team in El Segundo, CA, Huntington Beach, CA, or Fairfax, VA. Our team creates the next generation products and services for the BDS business unit. We work with proprietary customers in the development of the next-generation technologies in space. The team focuses on rapid prototyping to demonstrate a host of mission-focused technologies for a variety of customers. Our group works all facets of engineering from technology investment, concept development, proposal writing, requirements and design, build, integration, test, and demonstration of products in their relevant environments.

The Senior Grounds Systems Manager will lead, manage, develop and motivate an integrated team of multiple discipline engineers with diverse backgrounds and skill levels in developing key ground technology solutions for customer needs in El Segundo, CA, Huntington Beach, CA or Fairfax, VA. This manager shall develop and execute project and process plans, implement policies and procedures and sets operational goals, acquire resources for projects and processes, provides technical management of suppliers and leads process improvements, develop and maintain relationships and partnerships with customers, stakeholders, peers, partners and direct reports, provides oversight and approval of technical approaches, products and processes. This position requires demonstrated experience in quantum technologies, high-fidelity digital twin technologies, a diverse background of project management experience, and the clear exhibition of superior judgment and decision making to engineer new solutions and support existing capabilities. Demonstrated strategic and critical thinking skills and exceptional troubleshooting capabilities are required.

The successful candidate will be responsible for the integrated planning, strategy development, program/project management and technical oversight of a portfolio composed of multiple research, development, prototyping or demonstration projects, each intended to develop future, next generation capabilities for Boeing.

Position Responsibilities:

Responsible for a portfolio (i.e., multiple) ground programs to include Disruptive Computing & Networks (DC&N) quantum technology research projects, involving:
• Budget planning and execution.
• Staffing – identify ground engineering staffing needs, develop staffing plan, hire and staff personnel, and perform onboarding.
• Strategy development, alignment, execution, and communication.
• Ensure development of unique Design Practices in alignment with Ground Engineering capability.
• Monitor and manage program performance, resolving technical and program issues, controlling configurations, and maintaining metrics.
• Develop, adapt, and implement appropriate processes / procedures to ensure high quality output of all projects and disseminate as appropriate throughout DC&N .

​

Act as Responsible Manager for Ground Engineering, supporting Ground Capability horizontal integration of personnel resources:
• Develop division program specific Ground Strategy and integrate support development of division Ground Strategy Plan.
• Coordinate program and division activities with support organizations, ensure successful collaboration to further project objectives, including at a minimum:
• Finance Supplier Management.
• IT Communications.
• 'Legal (and IPM) Facilities.
• Government Operations Global Engagement.

Ensure effective interactions with Business Units and Enterprise:
• Articulate strategy, programmatic objectives, and technical capabilities under development.
• Identify high leverage opportunities for Ground Engineering projects to address Business Unit challenges, limitations, or constraints.
• Ensure insertion of Ground engineering technologies and future capabilities onto strategic roadmaps.
• Develop, negotiate, and ensure success of specific technology transitions between ground projects and Business Unit programs.

Ensure effective collaboration with current and future business partners:
• Manage supplier relationships to ensure successful project execution.
• Develop relationships with potential future business partners/suppliers.
• Construct effective agreements with business partners to meet strategic objectives.

Ensure effective communications with government customers:
• Shape future contracted research and development efforts.
• Position Boeing to be competitive for future efforts.
• Develop good working relationships with government decision makers in areas of relevance for Ground Engineering.

Champion employee recognition, increase employee satisfaction and ensure workplace safety.

This position is expected to be 100% onsite. The selected candidate will be required to work onsite at one of the listed location options.

This position requires active U.S. Top Secret/SCI Security Clearance (U.S. Citizenship Required). An ability to obtain an adjudicated CI (Counter Intelligence) polygraph will be required post start.

Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):
• Bachelor, Master or Doctorate of Science degree from an accredited course of study, in Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or other technical degree.
• 10+ years of experience working in Project/program management.
• 10+ years of experience leading cross-functional engineering teams.
• 10+ years of experience and technical leadership on a development and production programs.

·

Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience)
• Active CI Polygraph.
• 10+ years of experience in performing satellite ground system and/or subsystem systems engineering.
• 5+ years of systems or software engineering experience on space-based systems.
• Experience with quantum information science and technology as well as familiar with related engineering disciplines such as mechanical, thermal, electrical, computer, and systems engineering.

​

Relocation:

This position offers relocation based on candidate eligibility.

Drug Free Workplace:

Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.

Shift:

This position is for 1st shift.

At Boeing, we strive to deliver a Total Rewards package that will attract, engage and retain the top talent. Elements of the Total Rewards package include competitive base pay and variable compensation opportunities.

The Boeing Company also provides eligible employees with an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and a number of programs that provide for both paid and unpaid time away from work.

The specific programs and options available to any given employee may vary depending on eligibility factors such as geographic location, date of hire, and the applicability of collective bargaining agreements.

Please note that the salary information shown below is a general guideline only. Salaries are based upon candidate experience and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.

Summary pay range Min - Max: $191,000 – $258,000

Export Control Requirements: U.S. Government Export Control Status: This position must meet export control compliance requirements. To meet export control compliance requirements, a “U.S. Person” as defined by 22 C.F.R. §120.15 is required. “U.S. Person” includes U.S. Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee.

Export Control Details: US based job, US Person required

Equal Opportunity Employer:

Boeing is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military/veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Qualifications: This position requires demonstrated experience in quantum technologies, high-fidelity digital twin technologies, a diverse background of project management experience, and the clear exhibition of superior judgment and decision making to engineer new solutions and support existing capabilities

Job Summary of the Senior Engineering Manager

Our client, a developer of commercially-viable electric vehicles, is looking for a Senior Engineering Manager to manage the process and creation of requirements and specifications of internally developed controls functions. In this position, you'll be overseeing a team (5-6 reports) developing next generation EV controls.

This company is working on next generation EV technology, standing on firmer ground than its competitors.
Responsibilities of the Senior Engineering Manager
• Coordinate team deliverables to align the team to the company objectives and timing
• Define the process and scope for Controls requirements
• Define the process and scope for Controls specifications
• Work with other cross functional teams such as Chassis, ADAS, Thermal and Powertrain
• Be a technical resource for and contribute to the following team deliverables
• Functional Requirements
• Functional Specifications
• Functional Safety Goals/Concepts
• Functional debugging and support
• Assist and provide personnel management for a growing team of system engineers within the US
• Attend technical and program meetings as Control Systems representative

Qualifications of the Senior Engineering Manager
• Bachelor of Science or above in Computer Engineering, Software Engineering or Computer Science
• 10+ years of engineering experience in automotive/vehicle systems engineering
• 2-3+ years of management experience (not too removed from hands-on work)
• Strong background in requirements development for vehicle controls
• Familiarity with ISO26262
• Strong technical capability to understand software design concepts and implementations
• Strong technical writing ability to create clear and concise architectures and requirements
• A strong sense of ownership through the full development life-cycle

Compensation of the Senior Engineering Manager

Salary Range- $135,000-170,000 /year

Location: Phoenix, AZ

Type: Direct

Travel: Minimal

Relocation Assistance: Yes

Visa Sponsorship: H1B transfers only (or TN).

10+ years of engineering experience in automotive/vehicle systems engineering
2-3+ years of management experience (not too removed from hands-on work)
Strong background in requirements development for vehicle controls
Familiarity with ISO26262
Strong technical capability to understand software design concepts and implementations
Strong technical writing ability to create clear and concise architectures and requirements
A strong sense of ownership through the full development life-cycle

data.job_description:
This role is an opportunity for a technologist with a passion for Linux and Cloud technologies to build a career with Canonical and drive the success with those leveraging Ubuntu and open source products. If you have an affinity for open source development and a passion for technology, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.

Engineering Manager

The BootStack team designs, builds, and operates modern distributed systems on private infrastructure for customers. From Kubernetes to OpenStack and everything in-between, you’ll be working with the latest technology in a fast-paced engineering environment. As a OpenStack Engineering Manager for the BootStack team, you will be responsible for managing the engineers that oversee day-to-day Managed Service of customer environments, including customer service management, managed services operations and consistent product improvement engineering. Collaboration with customers, product engineering, and operations is critical to success.

As an Engineering Manager you will:
• Manage a growing engineering team to optimise the quality and velocity of both development and operations
• Identify and measure team health indicators
• Implement disciplined engineering and operations processes
• Represent the BootStack team with respect to stakeholders, customers, and external teams
• Ensure proper team focus on priorities, milestones, and deliverables
• Work to meet service level agreements with customer deployments around the globe
• Deliver quality managed services in a consistent, timely manner

The successful Engineering Manager candidate will have:
• Bachelors (or equivalent) education in a technology field
• Proven track record of professional experience of either software delivery using Python, Go, C, C++, Java, or similar and/or managing operations teams
• Proven experience with OpenStack
• Demonstrated strong commitment to testing methodologies and maintainable code quality
• Experience with Linux system administration, Ubuntu/Debian a plus
• Strong communication and cooperation skills
• Experience with agile software development methodologies
• Experience working in and managing distributed teams
• Technical aptitude for understanding complex distributed systems
• Experience with cloud topologies and technologies
• Travel to team and company events and customer meetings, roughly 20% or less

About Canonical

Canonical is a growing, international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu -- the world’s #1 cloud operating system. Our mission is to realize the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services help businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.

We offer:
• 100% work-from-home
• Learning and development
• Competitive salary
• Recognition rewards
• Annual leave
• Priority Pass for travel

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

#LI-Remote

Qualifications: Bachelors (or equivalent) education in a technology field
Proven track record of professional experience of either software delivery using Python, Go, C, C++, Java, or similar and/or managing operations teams
Proven experience with OpenStack
Demonstrated strong commitment to testing methodologies and maintainable code quality
Strong communication and cooperation skills
Experience with agile software development methodologies
Experience working in and managing distributed teams
Technical aptitude for understanding complex distributed systems
Experience with cloud topologies and technologies
Travel to team and company events and customer meetings, roughly 20% or less

MOGAS is seeking an Engineering Manager to join our Modules team. This role will be responsible for successfully leading all technical disciplines related to MOGAS modules development and execution by building and managing a diverse team of engineers from various disciplines, formulating and executing strategies and collaborating with others to ensure projects and engineering duties are executed.

Day to day responsibilities will include:
• Effectively developing and maintaining a Modules technical organization that includes all relevant disciplines in support of quotes and active projects.
• Effectively oversee engineering team who ensure that all Module projects delivered are technically fit for purpose and meet the statutory requirements

Experience in construction of industrial facilities, petroleum processing facilities, refineries, petrochemicals and pipeline construction highly preferred. Working knowledge of codes & standards such as ASME, DOT, API, OSHA, and AWS inspection procedures.

data.job_description:
About SimpliSafe

We’re a high-tech home security company that’s passionate about protecting the life you’ve built. So, we’ve created a culture here that cares just as deeply about the career you’re building. Ours is a no-ego culture of collaboration and innovation where those seeking their next challenge can find big opportunities, and make a huge impact on the lives of all those that we protect. We don’t just want you to work here. We want you to grow and thrive here.

Why are we hiring?

Well, we’re growing and thriving. So, we need smart, talented, and humble people who share our values to join us as we relentlessly pursue our goal of ensuring everyone feels safe in their own home.

Job Description

As a private-equity-backed, hyper-growth IoT leader, SimpliSafe has made building a world-class fully internationalized e-commerce platform a Board level priority. We are in the very early stages of building this capability and are looking for a hands-on technical leader to drive this initiative and lead the team to get it done. This is a unique opportunity to design and build an integrated solution for a proven market leader.

SimpliSafe’s Device Platform organization is looking for an Engineering Manager to lead our Device Connectivity team. This team is responsible for many of the edge systems that manage the critical interactions between our cloud environment and the security devices in customers’ homes. In this team, you’ll help us maintain the high degrees of reliability and performance needed to make every home secure, while supporting the introduction of exciting new security devices and capabilities for years to come.

What You'll Do:
• Directly manage a team of 5-7 developers.
• Hire and grow world-class people for your team.
• Collaborate with product owners to translate business requirements into platform capabilities that deliver value for our customers - both now and in the future.
• Oversee the day-to-day operation of the team. Ensure continuous delivery of customer value. Maintain a high level of technical excellence and reliability by working directly with your team every sprint.
• Help create a technical vision that maximizes security for our customers and flexibility for our business. Guide your team to deliver on that vision.

The ideal candidate has experience leading agile teams and a passion for developing people and acting as a force multiplier, while having the technical strength to get in the weeds and accurately assess and grow team and individual performance.

What You'll Bring:
• Be collaborative by nature
• Be adept at building consensus to solve technical and organizational challenges
• Enjoy challenges and problem solving, helping to scale your team’s work and accelerate delivery via continuous improvement
• 5+ years of professional software development experience, with a track record of delivering flexible, reliable, cloud-based APIs
• 1-2 years of people management experience
• Experience with C++, Go, Python, and AWS is preferred but not required
• Experience in an IoT environment is helpful but not required

Benefits & Perks:
• Health, dental and vision coverage - We cover 80% of plans and offer excellent BCBS HMO/PPO Health plans
• Unlimited paid time off - To give you the flexibility and work/life balance you seek
• 401k Matching and Company Equity - To help you prepare for the future
• Bagel Thursdays, Bi-Weekly Lunches, Team and Company Outings – We know how to have fun! Besides, who doesn’t like free food and drinks?!

What Values You’ll Share:
• Customer Obsessed - Building deep empathy for customers and developing strong, long-term relationships with them.
• Aim High - Always challenging oneself and others to raise the bar.
• No Ego - “no job too small” attitude, and open, inclusive and humble style.
• One Team - highly collaborative approach to achieving success.
• Lift As We Climb - A track record of investing in developing others and helping others succeed.
• Lean & Nimble - working with agility and efficiency to experiment in an often-ambiguous environment.

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Likewise, we are committed to full support of qualified individuals in hiring and employment. In keeping with this commitment, we will work with qualified individuals with disabilities to assess whether a reasonable accommodation may be provided to perform the essential functions of their role, absent undue hardship. If a reasonable accommodation may be needed to fully participate in the job application or interview process, to perform the essential functions of a position, or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact careers@simplisafe.com.

SimpliSafe focuses on Security, Consumer Electronics, Internet of Things, Hardware + Software, and Home Automation. Their company has offices in Boston and Manchester. They have a large team that's between 501-1000 employees. To date, SimpliSafe has raised $57M of funding; their latest round was closed on May 2014.

You can view their website at http://simplisafe.com or find them on Twitter, Facebook, and Product Hunt.

Qualifications: The ideal candidate has experience leading agile teams and a passion for developing people and acting as a force multiplier, while having the technical strength to get in the weeds and accurately assess and grow team and individual performance
5+ years of professional software development experience, with a track record of delivering flexible, reliable, cloud-based APIs
1-2 years of people management experience
Experience in an IoT environment is helpful but not required

Hire and grow world-class people for your team
Collaborate with product owners to translate business requirements into platform capabilities that deliver value for our customers - both now and in the future
Oversee the day-to-day operation of the team
Ensure continuous delivery of customer value
Maintain a high level of technical excellence and reliability by working directly with your team every sprint
Help create a technical vision that maximizes security for our customers and flexibility for our business
Guide your team to deliver on that vision
Be collaborative by nature
Enjoy challenges and problem solving, helping to scale your team’s work and accelerate delivery via continuous improvement
Benefits: Health, dental and vision coverage - We cover 80% of plans and offer excellent BCBS HMO/PPO Health plans
Unlimited paid time off - To give you the flexibility and work/life balance you seek
401k Matching and Company Equity - To help you prepare for the future
Bagel Thursdays, Bi-Weekly Lunches, Team and Company Outings – We know how to have fun!

data.job_description:
Thales Defense & Security, Inc. is a global company serving the defense, federal, and commercial markets with innovative solutions for the ground tactical, airborne and avionics, naval/maritime, and public safety and security domains. In addition to mission-critical communication systems, the company provides helmet-mounted displays and motion tracking technologies; SATCOM terminals; advanced sonar systems; and data protection solutions. Furthermore, the company serves as a gateway for technology, leveraging Thales-wide solutions—such as combat management systems; naval, airborne, and ground ISR; and electronic warfare—to address U.S. requirements.

Thales is seeking a dynamic and experienced Engineering Services Manager with a proven ability to manage a multi-disciplined team to support all aspects of Configuration Data Management (CDM) and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) for projects and products including hardware and software for U.S. Military customers. This role is well suited for candidates with proven success as an engineering or technical manager, engineer project manager, or program manager in fast paced complex DOD government contracting environment.

Top Benefits
• Competitive Salary
• Yearly Incentive Bonus Program
• Generous 401(k) program - up to 7% company contribution and 100% immediate vesting
• Tuition Reimbursement
• Paid wellness, vacation, and holiday leave
• Paid maternity, paternity, and parental leave
• 9/80 Work Schedule (every other Friday off)
• Hybrid working environment

Responsibilities
• Manage all aspects of an Engineering Services department, which includes Configuration Data Management (CDM) and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) functions, in support of design, development, manufacturing and repair of products for U.S. Military Programs of Record.
• Perform personnel management, subcontract management, cost estimating, scheduling, and proposal preparation.
• Provide engineering services to projects and customers internal and external to Thales.
• Create and maintain processes and metrics, and the proven ability to delegate workload to complete assignments on time in support of a fast-paced engineering development and production-manufacturing environment.
• Manage the team that performs configuration management for product design and development of U.S. Military Programs of Record, including: release of design data (e.g. engineering drawings, design documents, CAD, software and BOMs) into the PLM database; manage engineering change process (e.g. ECRs, ECNs, and ECOs).
• Manage the tools used for Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) and configuration management (e.g. PTC WindChill) and the interface of the PLM tool to an Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system.
• Support Audits, including Product Configuration Audits (PCAs) with the customer and AS9100/CMMI certifications
• Manage the team that will generate and maintain technical manuals and reports to MIL standards including user technical manuals; depot repair manuals; training plans and materials; failure analysis reports; reliability, availability, maintainability, and testability (RAMT) calculations and reports; provisioning and sparing plans, and safety assessment reports.
• Meet directly with the customers to review and deliver ILS CDRLS, including end-user training, depot transition, logistics demonstration, and customer interim status and validation events.

Supervisory Responsibilities:

The principle duty of this position is to provide day-to-day supervision, leadership and support to the business, ensuring smooth and efficient operations in accordance with the organization’s operating policies and applicable laws. This will require the incumbent to continually search for opportunities to enhance processes and the product using a variety of problem solving techniques, effective interpersonal and communication skills, along with technical competency. Incumbent will motivate, coach and encourage employees to optimize career development and personal satisfaction. You will promote excellent employee relations and empowerment of all personnel within a multifunctional team Must be able to drive performance create good team cohesion, maintain departmental budget, effectively plan and retain resources.

Qualifications
• U.S. Citizenship required.
• Applicants selected may be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.
• Bachelor’s Degree (BA/BS/BE) or AA technical degree with equivalent work relevant experience.
• 5+ years’ experience managing teams of 5 or more technical staff directly or indirectly. Prefer cross functional experience in this area.
• Agile with strong people skills with the ability to resolve conflicts and crisis.
• Excellent organizational skills and work ethic.
• Experience managing multiple projects simultaneously.
• Strong technical writing skills.
• Strong problem solving and analytical skills.
• Ability to interact in a team environment with employees across all departments and functions.
• Process and Quality oriented and able to implement and refine processes to achieve efficiency with high quality.
• Understanding of Configuration Data Management (CDM) and Change Management (CM) to DoD/Mil Standards and data formats (e.g. EIA-649, MIL-HDBK-61A, etc) for projects and products including hardware and software; strong understanding of CDM defense industry best practices.
• Experience with use of Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) software tools (e.g. PTC WindChill); CDM tools admin/management level experience a plus.
• Understanding of ILS concepts, analyses, technical publications, and CDRLs for U.S. Military customers and contracts, including: End-User and Depot Level Technical Manuals to MIL standards using ILS technical publication XML coding software (e.g. ArborText); Training plans, Instructor Guides, Trainee Guides, and Training Presentation packages; Failure Analysis Reports; Reliability, Availability, Maintainability, and Testability (RAMT) calculations and reports; Maintenance, Provisioning, and Sparing Plans including Level of Repair Analysis, Maintenance Allocation Chart (MAC), and Performance Based Logistics Plans; and Safety Assessment Reports
• Understanding of Agile development concepts and tools
• Proficient with collaboration software tools (i.e. Atlassian Confluence and JIRA) and MS Office Suite (i.e. Word, Excel, Project, etc.) or similar software.

Thales champions inclusion and we believe diversity strengthens the fabric of our culture. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer/AA/Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disabled. Thales is an E-Verify employer.

Thales is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age or any other characteristic protected by law.

If you need an accommodation or assistance in order to apply for a position with Thales, please call Human Resources at 240-864-7630.

data.job_title: Senior Ground Engineering Manager - Now Hiring
data.job_description:
Job Description

At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.

The Boeing Defense, Space and Security (BDS), Ground Development and Mission Operations Division, is seeking a Senior Ground Engineering Manager (Level M) to join our team in El Segundo, CA, Huntington Beach, CA, or Fairfax, VA. Our team creates the next generation products and services for the BDS business unit. We work with proprietary customers in the development of the next-generation technologies in space. The team focuses on rapid prototyping to demonstrate a host of mission-focused technologies for a variety of customers. Our group works all facets of engineering from technology investment, concept development, proposal writing, requirements and design, build, integration, test, and demonstration of products in their relevant environments.

The Senior Grounds Systems Manager will lead, manage, develop and motivate an integrated team of multiple discipline engineers with diverse backgrounds and skill levels in developing key ground technology solutions for customer needs in El Segundo, CA, Huntington Beach, CA or Fairfax, VA. This manager shall develop and execute project and process plans, implement policies and procedures and sets operational goals, acquire resources for projects and processes, provides technical management of suppliers and leads process improvements, develop and maintain relationships and partnerships with customers, stakeholders, peers, partners and direct reports, provides oversight and approval of technical approaches, products and processes. This position requires demonstrated experience in quantum technologies, high-fidelity digital twin technologies, a diverse background of project management experience, and the clear exhibition of superior judgment and decision making to engineer new solutions and support existing capabilities. Demonstrated strategic and critical thinking skills and exceptional troubleshooting capabilities are required.

The successful candidate will be responsible for the integrated planning, strategy development, program/project management and technical oversight of a portfolio composed of multiple research, development, prototyping or demonstration projects, each intended to develop future, next generation capabilities for Boeing.

Position Responsibilities:

Responsible for a portfolio (i.e., multiple) ground programs to include Disruptive Computing & Networks (DC&N) quantum technology research projects, involving:
• Budget planning and execution.
• Staffing – identify ground engineering staffing needs, develop staffing plan, hire and staff personnel, and perform onboarding.
• Strategy development, alignment, execution, and communication.
• Ensure development of unique Design Practices in alignment with Ground Engineering capability.
• Monitor and manage program performance, resolving technical and program issues, controlling configurations, and maintaining metrics.
• Develop, adapt, and implement appropriate processes / procedures to ensure high quality output of all projects and disseminate as appropriate throughout DC&N .

​

Act as Responsible Manager for Ground Engineering, supporting Ground Capability horizontal integration of personnel resources:
• Develop division program specific Ground Strategy and integrate support development of division Ground Strategy Plan.
• Coordinate program and division activities with support organizations, ensure successful collaboration to further project objectives, including at a minimum:
• Finance Supplier Management.
• IT Communications.
• 'Legal (and IPM) Facilities.
• Government Operations Global Engagement.

Ensure effective interactions with Business Units and Enterprise:
• Articulate strategy, programmatic objectives, and technical capabilities under development.
• Identify high leverage opportunities for Ground Engineering projects to address Business Unit challenges, limitations, or constraints.
• Ensure insertion of Ground engineering technologies and future capabilities onto strategic roadmaps.
• Develop, negotiate, and ensure success of specific technology transitions between ground projects and Business Unit programs.

Ensure effective collaboration with current and future business partners:
• Manage supplier relationships to ensure successful project execution.
• Develop relationships with potential future business partners/suppliers.
• Construct effective agreements with business partners to meet strategic objectives.

Ensure effective communications with government customers:
• Shape future contracted research and development efforts.
• Position Boeing to be competitive for future efforts.
• Develop good working relationships with government decision makers in areas of relevance for Ground Engineering.

Champion employee recognition, increase employee satisfaction and ensure workplace safety.

This position is expected to be 100% onsite. The selected candidate will be required to work onsite at one of the listed location options.

This position requires active U.S. Top Secret/SCI Security Clearance (U.S. Citizenship Required). An ability to obtain an adjudicated CI (Counter Intelligence) polygraph will be required post start.

Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):
• Bachelor, Master or Doctorate of Science degree from an accredited course of study, in Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or other technical degree.
• 10+ years of experience working in Project/program management.
• 10+ years of experience leading cross-functional engineering teams.
• 10+ years of experience and technical leadership on a development and production programs.

·

Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience)
• Active CI Polygraph.
• 10+ years of experience in performing satellite ground system and/or subsystem systems engineering.
• 5+ years of systems or software engineering experience on space-based systems.
• Experience with quantum information science and technology as well as familiar with related engineering disciplines such as mechanical, thermal, electrical, computer, and systems engineering.

​

Relocation:

This position offers relocation based on candidate eligibility.

Drug Free Workplace:

Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.

Shift:

This position is for 1st shift.

At Boeing, we strive to deliver a Total Rewards package that will attract, engage and retain the top talent. Elements of the Total Rewards package include competitive base pay and variable compensation opportunities.

The Boeing Company also provides eligible employees with an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and a number of programs that provide for both paid and unpaid time away from work.

The specific programs and options available to any given employee may vary depending on eligibility factors such as geographic location, date of hire, and the applicability of collective bargaining agreements.

Please note that the salary information shown below is a general guideline only. Salaries are based upon candidate experience and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.

Summary pay range Min - Max: $191,000 – $258,000

Export Control Requirements: U.S. Government Export Control Status: This position must meet export control compliance requirements. To meet export control compliance requirements, a “U.S. Person” as defined by 22 C.F.R. §120.15 is required. “U.S. Person” includes U.S. Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee.

Export Control Details: US based job, US Person required

Equal Opportunity Employer:

Boeing is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military/veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Demonstrated strategic and critical thinking skills and exceptional troubleshooting capabilities are required

data.job_description:
Engineering Manager

Expand your professional career as an Engineering Manager with MAU's client in Harvey, IL. As an Engineering Manager, you will be responsible for the technical aspects and marketing of the Mechanical SBU product. This is a direct hire opportunity.

Our client is forging a future where their employees, customers, suppliers, shareholders, and communities are building better together - a future focused on serving the customer and powering and protecting the world. With a global network of manufacturing and distribution facilities worldwide, their company is a leading provider of electrical, safety, and infrastructure solutions.

REQUIREMENTS:
• Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering (MBA preferred)
• 10+ years of experience in a Mechanical/Structural Engineering and technical sales role
• Experience with commercial industry
• Knowledge of steel and/or steel products (pipe and tube experience a plus)
• Project/Program/Finance and development experience

RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Develop and maintain Engineering information related to Mechanical Tube products
• Serve as the project manager for Commercial Projects as related to Mechanical Tube
• Liaise with Sales Managers with respect to technical information and engineering calculations for customers
• Conduct educational sessions with customers and/or at association events
• Maintain and edit Mechanical Calculator base engineering data for website
• Identify adjacent vertical market opportunities for penetration through core product modification or new product development
• Rationalize product line SKUs for reduced complexity and cost
• Assist with development of innovation projects and research
• Develop strong internal relationships with BU product marketing, sales, operating, and customer service departments
• Assist with the creation of promotional information
• Conduct market research studies and competitor analyses

Who is MAU?

MAU Workforce Solutions is an innovative global company with extensive experience providing solutions for success in staffing, recruiting, technology and outsourcing to our clients, employees, and applicants. Headquartered in Augusta, GA since 1973, MAU is a family and minority-owned company offering better processes and better people to create efficiencies and greater profits for our clients. Our relationships with world-class companies, our training programs and our culture of family allow MAU to offer better results, better jobs, and better lives to those who work with us.

All Applicants must submit to background check and drug screening.

Disclaimer: This not designed to be a complete list of all duties, responsibilities, and safety requirements required of the Engineering Manager position.

data.job_description:
About TaxBit

Founded in 2018 by CPAs, tax attorneys, and software developers, TaxBit is establishing an entirely new category of business to enable widespread adoption of cryptocurrency and other digital assets.

Our Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) platform streamlines our customers’ reporting and accounting experience for the digital asset class. We are trusted by thousands of consumers, leading crypto and traditional financial enterprises, government agencies—including the IRS— respected accounting firms, and others to solve compliance challenges at scale amid an ever-evolving regulatory landscape. TaxBit investors include Haun Ventures, IVP, Insight Partners, Paradigm, Tiger Global, PayPal Ventures, Winklevoss Capital, Coinbase Ventures, and other leading crypto investors. Our team is located in New York City, Salt Lake City, San Francisco, Seattle, and Washington, D.C.

If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your growth, recognizes your unique contribution, and provides a fun, flexible, and inclusive work environment, then TaxBit is the place for you. We’re looking for team members who are ready to join a hypergrowth company and excited to work at the forefront of an entirely new industry.

The Role

TaxBit’s Security and Engineering team is growing. In order to deliver quality products with high velocity, we need leaders to develop talent and solve challenging technical problems.

The Engineering Manager, Security Platform will lead and help support our security teams with the goal of safeguarding our internal data, users’ data, and maintaining their trust. The Security Engineering Team executes across TaxBit’s initiatives, including building a robust security infrastructure, API security, managing assessments, testing and controls related to compliance.

This role will drive security and compliance strategy for our mission to enable digital assets. They will collaborate with engineering leadership, our legal and compliance team, and other stakeholders to understand the customer and business needs.

Key Responsibilities
• Help design, define, and implement the global security strategy for TaxBit’s products and services including products that are subject to government controls.
• Provide technical expertise across the organization, including but not limited to: incident management, security infrastructure, architecture & design, and reliability.
• Continue to enable a team of compliance professionals that will identify necessary in-scope systems and applications, and guide technical teams and stakeholders to implement required controls and meet compliance.
• Ensure processes and systems exist to facilitate required training courses for employees regarding security and compliance.
• Maintain compliance and security industry best practices and suggest improvements across TaxBit (with definable measures of success).
• Oversee vendor security assessments, vulnerability and penetration testing, and collect and manage evidence for audits.
• Maintain industry best-practice security engineering standards for the design and development of TaxBit’s core product suite, services, and infrastructure.
• Partner with our People and Culture teams to hire and grow the best talent in industry.

Required Qualifications
• 8+ years of hands on software development
• 2+ years as people manager
• Excellent communication and leadership skills
• Experience attracting and developing top talent
• Familiar with modern cloud architecture
• Ability to problem-solve and assist teams with solutions to technical problems

Desired Skills
• Familiarity with building SaaS cloud-based products
• Experience managing sensitive data and working with security and compliance teams
• Thrives in early-stage environments and can handle ambiguity

The base salary range for this role is $156,000-$220,000. Certain roles may be eligible for incentive compensation, equity, and benefits. Actual compensation will vary depending on various job-related factors, including, but not limited to location, experience, level, and job qualifications.

Why you want to work here
• Competitive cash and equity compensation
• A robust offering of health, dental, and vision benefits with certain plans eligible for 100% premium coverage
• An investment in your mental wellbeing with free access to Headspace as well as company-wide mental health days/weeks
• A modern 401(k) plan that includes access to crypto, financial wellness benefits, low fees, and more
• Unlimited Time Off - enjoy the flexibility to take time away to rest, refuel, and recharge whenever needed and without worry
• Paid parental leave to bond with your new child
• Inclusive activities such as rock climbing, trivia/game nights, monthly mingles, and more!
• Company-provided Friday Lunches and unlimited snacks/drinks
• Autonomous work and flexibility in how work is performed

Disclaimers
• By submitting an application for this role, you certify that the information contained in the application is correct to the best of your knowledge. You understand that to falsify information is grounds for refusing to hire you, or for discharge should you be hired.
• Employment with the Company is at will unless otherwise stated in a written agreement signed by the CEO of the Company. This means that either the Company or the employee can terminate the employment at any time and for any reason, with or without notice.

2+ years as people manager
Excellent communication and leadership skills
Experience attracting and developing top talent
Familiar with modern cloud architecture
Ability to problem-solve and assist teams with solutions to technical problems

Unlimited Time Off - enjoy the flexibility to take time away to rest, refuel, and recharge whenever needed and without worry
Paid parental leave to bond with your new child
Inclusive activities such as rock climbing, trivia/game nights, monthly mingles, and more!
Company-provided Friday Lunches and unlimited snacks/drinks
Autonomous work and flexibility in how work is performed

Are you passionate about human space exploration, understanding the origins of the universe, and working with a passionate and diverse team to make a difference? If you are, we need you!

We need your talent, teamwork, and energy to help us achieve great things that inspire people all over the globe. We need you to bring creative ideas and diverse backgrounds to help us envision, shape, and deliver systems that will enable the exploration of space while benefiting people here on Earth.

We have an exciting opportunity for an Electrical Power Lab Technical Manager to join our team with JETS II Teammate Company, Intuitive Machines.

The Gateway Power Lab Admin will:
• Provide technical Integration between Gateway labs, including managing interfaces between labs for joint tests
• Support services that affect the labs, including inter-lab network, physical and IT security, and
• facility
• Coordination with external teams on lab certification plans, integration with program goals and
• schedules, and implementation of common services and processes
• Participate, track, and report on event execution, including URR, TRR, for integrated
• demonstrations and tests
• Coordinate and Manage facility space utilization and occupation
• Design and develop the Lab Network including the Time Triggered Ethernet Network
• Design, recommend, procure, install, configure, and administer the computing hardware
• Design, recommend, procure, install, configure, secure, and administer operating systems including
• Linux, VxWorks, and Windows systems
• Install, configure, and troubleshoot vendor and partner software
• Ensure compliance, operational sustainment and work with It managers to ensure compliance
• Script repetitive tasks to ensure repeatability and rapid deployment
• Code event simulations to evaluate various impacts to power systems on the spacecraft during
• different events
• Effectively communicate with internal and external customers and be customer-focused
• Manage, update, and maintain configuration management of lab and resources including documenting and maintaining a comprehensive Lab Configuration and operation
• Conduct project and resource planning and reporting (PPBE and TCSR)
• Perform other duties as assigned
Qualifications

Requisition Qualifications:

This position has been posted at multiple levels. Depending on the candidate's experience, requirements, and business needs, we reserve the right to consider candidates at any level for which this position has been advertised.
• Requires a minimum of a bachelor's degree in Engineering and may be expected to have a related master's degree and normally possess 10-15 years of related experience.
• Linux/Unix system administration, communication, user authentication and storage design,
• development and maintenance
• Network analysis, configuration, and administration
• Firewall maintenance and administration
• Automation of system maintenance and reporting via scripting
• Experience with lab integration including facility and operations
• Experience with technical integration including hardware and software integration
• Experience with security planning, implementation, and maintenance
• Experience with software license management including tracking and procurement
• Demonstrate problem-solving background with accompanying troubleshooting skills
• Demonstrate effective communication with customers and other team members, both written and
• orally
• Able to quickly adapt to new situations and a willingness to learn new technologies
• Able to work independently as well as collectively within a team
• Must be willing to work onsite at Johnson Space Center
Requisition Preferences:
• TCP/IP Network analysis, configuration, and administration experience
• ARINC 664 Rate Constrained or SAE AS6802 Time Triggered Ethernet Experience
• System and software configuration management
• Server maintenance and backup
• System requirements analysis
• JSC network familiarity
• Hardware and software integration
• System and software configuration management
• System tuning and performance analysis
• System requirements analysis
• JSC network familiarity
• Software Development Life Cycle familiarity

data.job_description:
As a leader in the science of nutrition, Nestlé Health Science believes in empowering healthier lives for patients and consumers through a rich product portfolio featuring top brands such as Garden of Life®, Nature’s Bounty®, Vital Proteins®, Nuun®, Persona Nutrition®, BOOST®, Carnation Breakfast Essentials®, Peptamen®, Compleat Organic Blends®, and more, as well as through Aimmune Therapeutics, a biopharmaceutical company developing therapies to prevent, manage and treat food, GI and metabolic-related diseases.

Our team members are challenged to make a genuine impact and play an integral role in driving the business forward. We embrace a dynamic culture that always puts the consumer first, and where ownership, accountability and agility are celebrated at every level. To help our people thrive, we offer expansive career growth potential, the opportunity to work alongside and learn from talented colleagues with diverse backgrounds and skill sets, and a range of best-in-class benefits.

We have more than 11,000 employees around the world, and products available in over 140 countries.

This position is not eligible for Visa Sponsorship.

Position Summary

This position has primary responsibility, as Group Utilities Energy and Compliance Manager of North America NHSc manufacturing & Warehouse distribution centers as well lead the charge to support NHSc global footprint of manufacturing and distribution sites

Key Responsibilities:
• Providing technical expertise thus ensuring smooth production and supply of all sites following Nestle Engineering & Maintenance Foundation guidance and tools, by being safe and maintaining high efficient usage of the utility installations
• Establish, facilitate, and maintain the NCE / TPM systems for the Utilities group to sustainably achieve compliance of local & global regulations, and audit readiness all times.
• Provides leadership, development, and support team members under the guidance of the Nestle Management and Leadership Principles.
• As an Expert on Utilities and Energy lead for the Division, provided technical assistance, guidance and support as requested by the sites as well providing & sharing best practices on maintenance and management systems for generation systems management of (Chilled, Tower Water, Steam Generation, City and Industrial Water, Air Compressors and any other utilities systems needed by the business)
• Ensuring all time availability of all utilities through Nestle Maintenance Foundations, Standards, guidelines, to be audit ready
• Communicate & manage entire internal & external customer base, maintain, and troubleshoot system, and personnel problems. Keep utilities of plant in compliance with all legal and Nestle regulations.
• Provide expertise in utilities generation and maintenance of system, technical support for daily, 24*7 plant operations and capital projects. This includes managing projects, training appropriate individuals, and preparing documentation as required.
• Establish a KPI based utilities & energy tracking system to continuously drive excellence in line with NCE requirements
• Lead, drive sustainability & energy conservation initiatives – reduction in Co2e, GHG etc.,
liaison with Nestle Corporate for guidance & standards
• Travel to sites as needed to deliver the above & projects or as requested per business needs
• Follow factory safety & environmental objectives & targets
• Follow the plant safety rules; report incidents & unsafe conditions immediately
• Maintain compliance with regulations, and refer to the Safety & Environmental Management System(s) on all related procedures and programs.
• Understand the environmental aspects of the position and take action to reduce these environmental impacts by conserving paper, electricity, water etc. Will also recycle all appropriate materials (paper, plastic, food, etc.)
• Follow factory food safety, quality objectives & targets
• Follow Nestle Good Manufacturing Practices, report food safety and quality issues immediately.
• Maintain compliance with regulations and refer to Nestle Quality Management System on all related procedures and programs.
• Understand the food safety and quality aspects of the position as indicated on QMS, OJT's and SOP's that apply.

Experience and Education Requirements:
• Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or related field
• 5+ years in a manufacturing Aseptic / Food environment, with specific experience in utilities and facilities
• Experience supervising others

Requisition ID: 215382

It is our business imperative to remain a very inclusive workplace.

To our veterans and separated service members, you're at the forefront of our minds as we recruit top talent to join Nestlé. The skills you've gained while serving our country, such as flexibility, agility, and leadership, are much like the skills that will make you successful in this role. In addition, with our commitment to an inclusive work environment, we recognize the exceptional engagement and innovation displayed by individuals with disabilities. Nestlé seeks such skilled and qualified individuals to share our mission where you’ll join a cohort of others who have chosen to call Nestlé home.

The Nestlé Companies are an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer seeking diversity in qualified applicants for employment. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, gender, gender identity, age, religion, national origin, ancestry, disability, perceived disability, medical condition, genetic information, veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other protected status, as defined by applicable law. Prior to the next step in the recruiting process, we welcome you to inform us confidentially if you may require any special accommodations in order to participate fully in our recruitment experience. Contact us at accommodations@nestle.com or please dial 711 and provide this number to the operator: 1-800-321-6467.

This position is not eligible for Visa Sponsorship.

5+ years in a manufacturing Aseptic / Food environment, with specific experience in utilities and facilities

data.job_description:
Data Network Engineering Manager

Richardson, Texas;Richmond, Virginia; Jersey City, New Jersey; Pennington, New Jersey; Charlotte, North Carolina
• *Job Description:**

Responsible for building and leading a team to deliver technology products and services that meet business outcomes. Ensures people development through coaching, mentoring, feedback, and hands-on career development. Develops a technology strategy and ensures technology solutions comply with applicable standards. This role advocates and advances modern, Agile solution delivery practices and evangelizes great design, engineering and organizational practices. Accountable for team/program level resource and financial management; builds and maintains teams through talent acquisition. Sets maturity objectives and enables individuals/teams to with training & resources to achieve them. Sets and tracks quality and performance objectives. Facilitates performance and career development of individuals through performance reviews, coaching, and building individual development plans that are needed to develop competencies and skills. Understands individual and team maturity and performance through team/client feedback. Manages relationships with the business and technology leaders, and vendors for technical products. Accountable for solution delivery management as relevant to their teams e.g. prioritizing tech debt, compliance and security items, and supporting audits. Accountable to ensure all relevant risk, financial, and compliance polices and standards are met. Accountable for the application performance in production (app health, resiliency, performance, security, enterprise data management standards, audit exams and reviews). Creates the technology strategy for their technical domain. Ensures that execution is aligned with product strategy by working with Product Management, Product Owners, and other stakeholders. Creates an inclusive and healthy working environment, and helps to resolve organizational impediments/blockers. Leads and creates followership in Communities of Practice in the organization. Manages a team.

The role is responsible for directing the physical and logical engineering deliverables, workflow and priorities for Global Networks. The Network Engineering Manager must always display good judgment and promotes this philosophy throughout the organization. The person in this role must understand the dynamics of risk vs. speed vs. quality. A fourth element to consider is how those choices impacts costs/finances and commitments. This position is in direct line to the technical services delivery workflow. The position must drive adherence to and the use of standards, product sets, templates, systems and artifacts which are important elements to achieving successful outcomes. They must understand how to identify problems early enough in the process to preserve change windows and dates; how and when to stop Design/Implementations or fight through to a successful completion.

The Network Manager is a point of escalation, solves problems and is a key decision maker. Areas of knowledge include but not limited to Voice (Enterprise, Trader and Contact Center), Unified/Real-Time Communications, Voice Messaging and Voice Recording (QA and Regulatory), Switched Voice and Transport Services, Cable and Building technologies, IP Network/Wide Area and Optical Technologies, Network Appliance/Firewalls, Extranet, Proxies, DNS/DHCP. The person in this role needs to know how to collaborate.

This position will interface directly with internal and external customers, network architecture and engineering, deployment and product/service management, operations, vendors, consultants and contractors. Strong written, verbal and presentation skills are a must. The Network Manager is a “thought-leader” and must be able to represent the strategic vision and goals of the organization to various stakeholders and shareholders.
• *Key Responsibilities:**

+ The candidate must understand the many attributes of how designs flow (based upon approved standards), participates in exceptions or new standard reviews and “commission and directs” the installation of all work

+ The Network Manager works globally in a federated model with regional execution

+ The Network Manger must understand how to schedule large, multi-technology projects for deployment. They must be able to accommodate schedule changes, emergencies, and reprioritizations. A big value is understanding how to leverage projects, change windows and initiatives to create the “most strategic long-term value” for the firm (stacking changes, real estate changes to help with end-of-life equipment replacement, etc.).

+ The role is critical in the overall technology delivery lifecycle not only across networks and the entire infrastructure group but also for lines of business initiatives that depend upon services from network technologies.
• *Key stakeholders are:**

+ Network Service Initiated (network projects for networks)

+ Line of Business demand (key clients/partners who need network services. This is both internal and external customers)

+ Global Real Estate (network support for real estate initiatives)
• *Required Skills:**

+ Minimum of 15+ years’ experience required in Network and Network disciplines, project and Service Delivery, Design and Deployment services

+ Strong skills in Scripting required; Python, Ansible, PowerShell,

+ Deep understanding of ITIL; has participated in design and/or deployment of major IT projects

+ Experience with SDN; ACI/NSX, Arista CloudVision

+ Experience with SDWAN, preferred if on Cloudgenix

+ Automation Skills – Expect, Rancid, REST/SOAP

+ Experience working in an Agile environment

+ Experience in various equipment manufacturers including but not limited to CISCO, Juniper, Arista, Brocade, EMC, HP/Aruba, etc
• *Desired Skills:**

+ Bachelor’s degree in engineering, computer science, MIS, related field and or technical training. Advanced technical/business degree is a plus

+ Must have strong analytical skills and the ability to make real time decisions

+ Understands how to manage risk

+ Strong background in IT service delivery role (i.e., engineering support for projects)

+ Leadership; Leads by Example

+ Self-starter and self-directed; Must be a good “coach and teacher”; Shows initiative

+ Focused on execution, delivery, and commitment to dates

+ Can link strategy and actions to business impact and results

+ Demonstrates ownership; must approach work with a “solutions, end to end mindset”

+ Is accountable and can hold others accountable

+ Ability to communicate and influence upward as well as laterally

+ Organized and detail oriented with a strong technical acumen

+ Ability to partner with others for the good of the initiative
• *Job Band:**

H4
• *Shift:**

1st shift (United States of America)
• *Hours Per Week:**

40
• *Weekly Schedule:**
• *Referral Bonus Amount:**

0
• *Job Description:**

data.job_description:
Overview

Talented and experienced, hands-on Software Engineering Manager to lead a team of software engineers delivering next generation of technology products for Topgolf. They will work closely with product owner, product and program managers to lead the software engineering function and ensure successful execution of the product roadmap.

Responsibilities
• Manage and lead the software engineering team, providing guidance, coaching, and mentoring to team members
• Develop and maintain software engineering standards and procedures, ensuring that they are adhered to by all team members
• Manage the recruitment, training, and development of software engineering staff
• Ensure that all software developed by the software engineering team meets the required security, scalability, and performance standards
• Drive a culture of continuous improvement within the software engineering function, identifying opportunities for improvement, and implementing changes to improve efficiency and effectiveness
• Design and write code across the full technology stack
• Partner with product managers and program managers to own and drive the product roadmap, using the Agile process to run efficient sprints and releases

Qualifications
• Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, preferred
• 7+ years Software Engineering
• 3+ years Technical leadership role
• 2+ years Direct management role
• 1+ years Experience coding and architecting applications for scale
• 3+ years Experience with both backend and front-end development
• 1+ years Proficiency in Scala, Akka, Actors
• 1+ years Proficiency in TypeScript Vue.js
• Experience in full-stack software engineering, with a proven track record of managing complex software development projects
• Experience in managing and leading teams of software engineers, providing guidance, coaching, and mentoring
• Strong project management skills, with the ability to develop and maintain software project plans and ensure that software projects are completed on time and to the required quality standards
• Excellent problem-solving skills and judgment
• Highly-motivated self-starter with a passion for making high quality software
• Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal
• Strong sense of ownership and drive
• Positive, enthusiastic attitude with ability to interact with cross-departmental groups

Travel up to 5% for team offsites.

ADA
