data.job_description:
Electrical Engineer Manager

Reports to: President

Summary/Objective

The Electrical Engineering Manager manages a team of electrical engineers who design, develop, program, innovate new ideas for current and new systems and develop new automation design criteria. Test all aspects of electrical components, equipment, and machinery.

Job Duties and Responsibilities

The Electrical Engineering Manager is responsible for communicating job expectations, training and development, and mentoring/coaching the Electrical Engineering staff to meet company objectives. Will develop processes and procedures, manage on-going project management, new product development and continuous improvement of existing product lines.
Essential Functions
• Provides electrical engineering guidance and technical support on electrical engineering reviews, strategic plans, and projects
• Creates unit and development cost estimations and helps determine affordable and reliable material sources
• Provides managerial support to Electrical Engineering Supervisor on assigning department personnel to projects
• Ensures on-time product management and development by collaborating with other departments to estimate reasonable and precise schedules and solve problems quickly
• Establishes technical standards in review, documentations, and designs
• Working with manufacturing and operations department, reviews and monitors quality and process improvements and new product development
• Manages vendor and subcontractor relationships
• Maintains safe and healthy work environment by establishing and enforcing standards and procedures, and complying with legal regulations
• Updates job knowledge by remaining current on codes and requirements; participating in educational opportunities; participating in professional organizations
• Maintains training and development standards for the entire department
• Drives innovation and new design concepts utilizing new technology.
• Works closely with Mechanical Engineering to help develop the necessary protocols for finished products while maintaining realistic design criteria that can be managed and achieved by both departments.
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Competencies
• Strong communication skills required (verbal, written and interpersonal)
• Experienced manager with strong organization skills, high standards and excellent leadership
• Demonstrates an expert comprehension of electrical schematics, codes, formulas, and troubleshooting/problem solving methods
• Excellent mechanical and technical skills
• Works well under pressure with changing priorities
• Promotes teamwork, initiative, dedication with department
• Proficient with Siemens S7-300 and S7-1500 logic and PLC programming a definite +

Supervisor Responsibilities

Position manages and supervises all employees in department.

Work Environment
• This job operates in a professional office environment with extended periods of sitting while using a computer
• While performing the essential duties of this job employee has exposure to a manufacturing environment such as, moving crane, fork-lift, and various metal machining centers

Physical Demands
• This position is active and requires the ability to walk, bend, squat, carry, stoop, kneel, crouch, or stand for periods of time
• Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust and focus
• Other exposures include reviewing existing and new designs with personnel on, above, or under machine as assembly progresses to review problems, interferences, resolutions, and future improvements.
Travel

Willing to travel domestically/internationally and obtain all health requirements subject by both airlines and specific entrance/exit essential requisites per visited country (Countries).

Required Education and Experience
• Bachelor Degree or Equivalent work Experience
• 3+ years relevant electrical engineering experience in electronic design and PLC programming
• 2-3+ years of experience managing engineering teams

Preferred Education and Experience
• Proficient in the use of Solid Works, 3D, and AutoCAD knowledge to interpret existing documentation
• Proficient knowledge and experience with PLC programming and MMI system knowledge for Siemens products
• Knowledge of control and design to meet pharmaceutical specifications
• International travel experience.

Additional Qualifications
• Knowledge of the pharmaceutical/health care industries and the associated regulatory requirements is helpful.
• Understanding and ability to interpret GAMP, CE, ISO, ANSI and other Global Standards as required for pharmaceutical applications is helpful.

P-CHI-006

data.job_description:
• *About this role:**

Wells Fargo is seeking a Software Engineering Senior Manager within the Enterprise Services Management group for the Vendor Risk Management & Strategic Portfolio Management ServiceNow Engineering team. This group provides engineering and delivery services to our Wells Fargo Cyber Security and Third Party Risk partners. The team consists of multiple geographically dispersed scrum teams developing solutions on ServiceNow and .Net platforms. In addition to existing team members, this role will be responsible for the build out of the Strategic Portfolio Management engineering team supporting Enterprise-wide change management organizations.
• *In this role, you will:**

+ Manage, coach, and develop a team or teams of experienced engineers and engineering managers in roles with moderate complexity and risk, responsible for building high quality capabilities with modern technology

+ Ensure adherence to the Banking Platform Architecture, and meeting non-functional requirements with each release

+ Partner with, engage and influence architects and experienced engineers to incorporate Wells Fargo Technology technical strategies, while understanding next generation domain architecture and enable application migration paths to target architecture; for example cloud readiness, application modernization, data strategy

+ Function as the technical representative for the product during cross-team collaborative efforts and planning

+ Identify and recommend opportunities for driving escalated resolution of technology roadblocks including code, build and deployment while also managing overall software development cycle and security standards

+ Determine appropriate strategy and actions to act as an escalation partner for scrum masters and the teams to meet moderate to high risk deliverables and help remove impediments, obstacles, and friction while encouraging constant learning, experimentation, and continual improvement

+ Build engineering skills side-by-side in the codebase, conduct peer reviews to evaluate quality and solution alignment to technical direction, and guide design, as needed

+ Interpret, develop and ensure security, stability, and scalability within functions of technology with moderate complexity, as well as identify, manage and mitigate technology and enterprise risk

+ Collaborate with, partner with and influence Product Managers/Product Owners to drive user satisfaction, influence technology requirements and priorities in the product roadmap, promote innovative and intelligent solutions, generate corporate value and articulate technical strategy while being a solid advocate of agile and DevOps practices

+ Interact directly with third party vendors and technology service providers

+ Manage allocation of people and financial resources to ensure commitments are met and align with strategic objectives in technology engineering

+ Hire, build and guide a culture of talent development to have the skills required to effectively design and deliver innovative solutions for product areas and products to meet business objectives and strategy, as well as conduct performance management for engineers and managers
• *Required Qualifications, US:**

+ 6+ years of Software Engineering experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education

+ 3+ years of Management experience

+ 5+ years of information technology systems design and planning experience; in data, systems, applications, or architecture

+ 2+ years of ServiceNow experience in building, implementing and maintaining large-scale platform technologies, workflows and integrations
• *Desired Qualifications:**

+ Experience in design and delivery for Enterprise Change Management

+ Experience in design and delivery for Cyber Security portolios

+ One or more of the following ServiceNow certifications: (CSA) Certified Systems Administrator, (CIS) Certified Implementation Specialist, or (CAD) Certified Application Developer
• *Job Expectations:**

+ Ability to negotiate, influence, and collaborate to build successful relationships

+ Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills

+ Ability to travel (up to 25%)

+ Collaboration with US and International team members

This role is not eligible for VISA sponsorship.
• *We Value Diversity**

At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, individuals with disabilities, pregnancy, marital status, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law.

Employees support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business unit's risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements.

Candidates applying to job openings posted in US: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Candidates applying to job openings posted in Canada: Applications for employment are encouraged from all qualified candidates, including women, persons with disabilities, aboriginal peoples and visible minorities. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available upon request in connection with the recruitment process.
• *Drug and Alcohol Policy**

Wells Fargo maintains a drug free workplace. Please see our Drug and Alcohol Policy to learn more.

data.job_description:
Overview

Weatherford is a leading global energy services company. Our world-class experts partner with customers to optimize their resources and realize the full potential of their assets. Across our operating locations, including manufacturing, research and development, service, and training facilities, operators choose us for strategic solutions that add efficiency, flexibility, and responsibility to any energy operation.

We are focused on technology development, digital solutions, and defining our footprint in the new energy space. Our ability to provide integrated solutions across our segments will be critical to growth in our core operations and the energy transition.

Energy producers face unique challenges every day, so it is our job to create solutions that enhance safety, streamline operations, and sustain uptime to meet or exceed their targets. We operate across the global energy landscape employing some of the best diverse talent in the industry. At Weatherford, we understand the value each individual brings to the table. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and are immensely proud of our workforce. We invite you to join our passionate, talented, word-class team.

When you join Weatherford, you instantly feel connected to something bigger - a community that is grounded by our core values and driven to create innovative solutions for our customers. We celebrate each other's successes, grow together, and learn from each other constantly. Individually, we are impressive. Together, we are unstoppable. We are One Weatherford.

Weatherford offers competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits program and provides you a challenging and enriching career path, with a healthy balance of structure and flexibility to chart your own course. We are focused on providing a challenging and enriching career path with a healthy balance of structure and flexibility to chart your own course. We are an innovative, global company with wide-ranging opportunities that include career-enhancing talent rotations. Our structured career paths will ensure that you know what it takes to build your ideal career at Weatherford when you join our Company. We also offer a comprehensive benefits program, including health insurance coverage, income protection plans, a 401(k) savings plan, Company paid holidays, and paid time off for vacation.

Weatherford is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Manage technical needs for Liner Hanger Systems equipment, applications, and installations in North America region. Advise training & competency, and business & technology development. Leads the team of applications and field engineers.

• P&L awareness - supporting improvements in cost efficiency, risk mitigation

• 2+ years experience managing & mentoring a team of field or applications engineers

Senior Engineering Manager - Brea, CA

Make Your Mark. Shape Your Future.

It takes great people to achieve greatness. People with a sense of purpose and integrity. People with a relentless pursuit of excellence. People who care about making things better For Those Who Make The World. Sound like you? Join our top-notch team of nearly 60,000 professionals globally who are making their mark on some of the world's most beloved brands, including DEWALT, CRAFTSMAN, CUB CADET, STANLEY and BLACK+DECKER

The Job
As an Engineering Manager, you'll be part of our Engineering team working as an onsite employee. You'll get to:
Lead the Manufacturing and Project Engineering team to deliver high quality technical output on time, focusing on accountability, efficiency, and learning; support the site and division strategies and initiatives.
Responsible for creating and maintaining adequate manufacturing procedure and processes; establish and enhance robust machining methods and tooling required for production; maintain accurate manufacturing standards.
Assist management with direct oversight of the manufacturing department's daily operations.
Establish metrics and monitor team productivity; track and develop plans to improve employee utilization and efficiency.
Develop and implement a cross-training plan and maintain workforce skill level to meet business requirements; and conduct employee performance reviews/evaluations and development discussions to ensure professional growth.
Manage the department budget including staffing levels and overtime recommendations.
Lead efforts to identify root cause and instill the culture of problem solving; make appropriate process changes, and implementation of sustainable short/long term corrective and preventive actions; reduce or eliminate recurrence of quality issues and minimize scrap/rework costs

The Person

You love to learn and grow and be acknowledged for your valuable contributions. You're not intimidated by innovation. Wouldn't it be great if you could do your job and do a world of good? In fact, you embrace it. You also have:

BS degree in Mechanical, Electrical, Aerospace or System Engineering or related technical field
Six (6) years minimum experience as a Manufacturing Engineer or equivalent role
Three (3) years minimum of manager/leadership experience in a manufacturing setting
Ability to research, compile and analyze data effectively for reports or decision making
Strong working knowledge of Six Sigma and Lean tools and methodologies
Machining, metal-forming or complex assembly experience

The Details
• Competitive salary
• Medical, dental, life, vision, wellness program, disability, 401(k), Employee Stock Purchase Plan, paid time off and tuition reimbursement.
• Discounts on Stanley Black & Decker tools and other partner programs.

And More
• Grow: Be part of our global company with 20+ brands to grow and develop your skills along multiple career paths.
• Learn: Have access to a wealth of learning resources, including our Lean Academy, Coursera and online university.
• Belong: Experience an awesome place to work, where we have mutual respect and a great appreciation for diversity, equity and inclusion.
• Give Back: Help us continue to make positive changes locally and globally through volunteerism, giving back and sustainable business practices.
#LI-CJ1 #LI-Onsite

• 20+ year old company doing $300M in revenue and growing
• Ability to be a key decision maker while building out a greenfield platform
About Our Client

My client is an industry leader in Healthcare Logistics. Founded in 2000, they've grown their business to operate in 32 states and are currently doing $300M in revenue year over year.

Their Engineering team is looking for a Technical Manager help build the tools that allow us to deliver our products to more people and drive their growth. As a Technical Manager, you will be in the weeds coding and building out the platform while reporting into the VP of Engineering and overseeing 2 direct reports. This role will be Front-End for the first year and candidates proficient in Angular are preferred. Following year one, this role will move into a full stack capacity operating in SalesForce on the backend.

You'll be responsible for a brand new B2B web portal that operates on Angular, Mulesoft, and Salesforce. The portal will be self-testing with zero-downtime deployment. The ideal candidate must be passionate about building products from the very early stages and will have ideally been a key contributor on a team that has built out an enterprise portal.

This is a hybrid role, with commute to the office expected 2x per month.
Job Description
• Develop solutions using Angular
• You will contribute to development, design and test automation best practices and procedures.
• This is Full-stack development position. Including data modeling/database, middleware, Front End UI, web-services, and deployment.
• Build next-generation web portals that are fast and responsive.
• Develop solutions in Salesforce technology
• Collaborate with onshore & offshore developers, Database developers to deliver integrated solution.
• Contribute to important team culture and contribute code to efforts across a fast-growing company
• Support, maintain and upgrade code and participate in implementation of a complex system
• Evaluate and recommend software technologies in these areas, evaluate alternatives and analyze problems with data infrastructures
• Oversee and develop 2 direct reports

MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.
The Successful Applicant
• 5-7 years of Angular experience
• Relevant experience in React or Vue will be considered
• Experience working on a team that has built out enterprise portals
• 4+ years of Back End developments in an Object Oriented language (C#/Java)
• A self-motivated individual who works well with little direction
• Cloud hosting, monitoring, performance tuning, and optimization experience is preferred
• Has excellent communication skills
• Love making and building things as part of a growing team
• Experience mentoring more junior developers
• Salesforce experience is a plus but not required
• Mulesoft experience is a plus but not required
• This is a hybrid role; candidates are expected to be able to reliably to commute to office in Chicago suburbs 2x per month
• Please note, my client is unable to provide sponsorship at this time.

• Salary up to $150k, based on experience and interviews
• 8% yearly bonus
• Health insurance with HSA
• 3 weeks of PTO to start + company holidays
• 401k with company match
• Employee Assistance Program
• Health, Dental, Vision
• Unlimited growth; this person will be the lead in building out a brand new greenfield development
• Direct access to the leadership team

data.job_description:
Job Description

Join the Clean Energy Revolution

Become an Engineering Manager, Subtransmission Planning at Southern California Edison (SCE) and build a better tomorrow. In this job, you will manage the Southern Subtransmission Planning team in Asset Strategy and Planning (ASP) which consists of seven engineers and one intern. You will be responsible for this team of Engineers who perform the technical analysis related to planning of the Subtransmission System to accommodate load growth and provide for capacity needs of new generation resources seeking interconnection to the SCE Distribution and Subtransmission System under the Rule 21 Tariff and Wholesale Distribution Access (WDAT) Tariff. In addition, the team also serves to provide for project sponsorship and development of the non-CAISO jurisdiction Subtransmission system.

The Engineering Manager is responsible for subtransmission-related activities, such as support for strategic objectives and participation in related regulatory activities (e.g., General Rate Case, Rule 21 and WDAT Tariff changes, etc.). As an Engineering Manager, your work will help power our planet, reduce carbon emissions and create cleaner air for everyone. Are you ready to take on the challenge to help us build the future?

A day in the life - Get ready to think big, work smart and shine bright!
• Lead the Engineers responsible for the subtransmission scope and projects for all levels of complexity, including licensing support to accommodate load growth and the interconnection of new generation energy resources
• Responsible for the development and growth of Engineers, managing job performance and goals
• Drive the various activities to support the studies required to serve load and interconnection of new generation resources, which includes the annual Subtransmission Planning for load growth and the Fast Track Evaluations, Independent, Facilities and Cluster Studies and any other related efforts associated with meeting Rule 21 and WDAT Tariff requirements
• Serve as a company expert witness advocating the Company’s position at the CPUC on issues dealing with subtransmission upgrades identified to be required to support load growth and to support new generation interconnections
• Lead efforts in evolving tools and developing new processes, such as adopting SCE Grid Modernization initiatives into the subtransmission planning process
• Coordinate distribution support of corporate objectives, such as the Wildfire Mitigation Plan, Pathway 2045, Transportation Electrification, and other strategic assessments and implementation

Qualifications

The essentials
• Bachelor’s Degree (or higher) in Electrical Engineering or Electrical Computer Engineering
• Five or more years of experience performing as an Engineer and/or Supervisor in distribution engineering and/or electrical system planning

The preferred
• Five or more years of distribution/subtransmission engineering experience
• Experience in the area of power system engineering analysis including knowledge of applicable regulations, standards, codes, and power flow software such as CYME, CAPE, PowerWorld, PSLF or other similar software
• Power Transmission or Distribution systems planning/modeling experience
• Experience analyzing and solving engineering problems and making sound decisions
• Excellent oral and written communication skills, including the ability to explain complex technical concepts in simple terms to both technical and non-technical personnel, including internal and external customers
• Ability to interface effectively and collaborate with clients, peers, project personnel, and all levels of management enterprise-wide to develop solutions and ensure stakeholder buy-in
• Ability to resolve conflicts in a manner which results in win-win solutions for all the parties involved
• Strong ethics and the ability to effectively manage stress and engage in continuous learning

You should know
• This position’s work mode is hybrid. The employee will report to an SCE facility or in the field location. Further details of this work mode will be discussed at the interview stage.
• Visit our Candidate Resource page to get meaningful information related to benefits, perks, resources, testing information, and hiring process, and more!
• Position may require up to 10% traveling and being out in the field throughout the SCE service territory.

Testing
• This position requires testing and applicants who are identified to continue through the selection process will be invited to test via email. Reference our Information Guides for the following test(s): Edison Leadership Workstyles (Test 8201). Candidates who have previously passed these assessment(s), in some cases, may not need to retest again for this position.

About Southern California Edison

The people at SCE don't just keep the lights on. Our mission is so much bigger. We’re fueling the kind of innovation that’s changing an entire industry, and quite possibly the planet. Join us and create a future with cleaner energy, while providing our customers with the safety and reliability they demand. At SCE, you’ll have a chance to grow personally and professionally, making a real impact in Southern California and around the world.

At SCE, we celebrate our differences. We are a proud Equal Opportunity Employer and will not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or any other protected status.

We are committed to ensuring that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodations at (833) 343-0727.

#LI-HY1

Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree (or higher) in Electrical Engineering or Electrical Computer Engineering
Five or more years of experience performing as an Engineer and/or Supervisor in distribution engineering and/or electrical system planning
Responsibilities: In this job, you will manage the Southern Subtransmission Planning team in Asset Strategy and Planning (ASP) which consists of seven engineers and one intern

You will be responsible for this team of Engineers who perform the technical analysis related to planning of the Subtransmission System to accommodate load growth and provide for capacity needs of new generation resources seeking interconnection to the SCE Distribution and Subtransmission System under the Rule 21 Tariff and Wholesale Distribution Access (WDAT) Tariff
In addition, the team also serves to provide for project sponsorship and development of the non-CAISO jurisdiction Subtransmission system

The Engineering Manager is responsible for subtransmission-related activities, such as support for strategic objectives and participation in related regulatory activities (e.g., General Rate Case, Rule 21 and WDAT Tariff changes, etc.). As an Engineering Manager, your work will help power our planet, reduce carbon emissions and create cleaner air for everyone
Responsible for the development and growth of Engineers, managing job performance and goals

Drive the various activities to support the studies required to serve load and interconnection of new generation resources, which includes the annual Subtransmission Planning for load growth and the Fast Track Evaluations, Independent, Facilities and Cluster Studies and any other related efforts associated with meeting Rule 21 and WDAT Tariff requirements

Serve as a company expert witness advocating the Company’s position at the CPUC on issues dealing with subtransmission upgrades identified to be required to support load growth and to support new generation interconnections
Lead efforts in evolving tools and developing new processes, such as adopting SCE Grid Modernization initiatives into the subtransmission planning process
Coordinate distribution support of corporate objectives, such as the Wildfire Mitigation Plan, Pathway 2045, Transportation Electrification, and other strategic assessments and implementation
Position may require up to 10% traveling and being out in the field throughout the SCE service territory

data.job_description:
General Atomics Electromagnetic Systems (GA-EMS) designs and manufactures first-of-a-kind electromagnetic and electric power generation systems. GA-EMS’ expanding portfolio of specialized products and integrated system solutions support critical fleet, space systems and satellites, missile defense, power and energy, and process and monitoring applications for defense, industrial, and commercial customers worldwide.

We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Space Project Engineering Manager working on satellite systems to join our team located in Englewood, CO.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
• This position typically reports to a senior technical manager and is responsible for the planning, managing and technical performance of one or more significant engineering unit(s).
• Directs all phases of assigned engineering project(s) from inception through completion.
• Responsibilities may require the integration of multiple disciplines and departments.
• Collaborates with technical staff, program managers and/or Division/Group executive management to develop and implement current, annual and long-term technical, schedule, quality, business and financial objectives for the unit(s).
• May also contribute to the development of annual and long-term objectives for the Division/Group. Objectives are typically accomplished through subordinate engineering managers.
• May be responsible for decisions that have an extended impact on outcomes where erroneous decisions could result in critical delays and modifications to projects.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
• Direct all activities for engineering project(s) including planning and managing technical performance to ensure quality, business, and financial objectives are attained.
• Develop and implement current, annual and long-term technical, schedule, quality, and business objectives for the space system engineering team.
• Ensure technical leadership and excellence is maintained by directing and participating in the planning, selection, retention, and development of staff as well as the selection, training and implementation of engineering tools.
• Lead mission, system and operational concept development for satellite missions for the space segments
• Oversee and participate in the system level design of space systems across all phases of projects, requirement analysis, sensitivity analysis, mission analysis, and design trade-offs.
• Oversee and participate in the system level design of small satellites for bid and proposals, product development and satellite operations.
• Lead and apply system engineering principles to the selection and design of subsystems and components.
• Apply technical knowledge to analyze, investigate and resolve engineering problems.
• Identify engineering issues and provide leadership in developing solutions.
• Prepare technical responses to bids, presentation materials and reports, for a variety of applications and customers.
• Contribute to the preparation of proposals, business plans, proposal work statements and specifications, operating budgets and financial terms/conditions of contract(s).
• Liaise with customer and supplier staff, and staff from other parts of GA.
• Participate in technology roadmap development.
• Participate with Group management in pursuing business partnerships, alliances, and joint ventures that enhance the capabilities of the space systems.
• Oversee the development of and ensure the security of the unit's proprietary technology, and maintain the strict confidentiality of sensitive information.
• Perform others duties as assigned or required.

We recognize and appreciate the value and contributions of individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences and welcome all qualified individuals to apply.

Job Qualifications:
• Typically requires a Bachelors, Masters or PhD in engineering or a related technical field as well as thirteen or more years of progressively complex engineering experience with at least seven of those years having management responsibilities. May substitute equivalent experience in lieu of education.
• Demonstrates extensive technical expertise and application of engineering principles, concepts, theory, and practice as well as comprehensive project management and leadership skills including organizing, planning, scheduling, and coordinating workloads to meet established deadlines or milestones.
• Must possess the ability to resolve complex management and technical problems.
• Strong communication, leadership, presentation, and interpersonal skills are required to enable an effective interface with other departments, all levels of management, professional and support staff, customers, potential customers, and government representatives.
• Customer focused, must be able to work on a self-initiated basis and in a team environment, and able to work extended hours and travel as required.
• A Professional Engineering License, and original work(s) published in professional engineering journals are desirable.

Salary:$140,900 - $257,233

data.job_description: Senior Software Engineering Manager Are you looking for an opportunity to engineer modern Cloud application, Continuous Deployment/Continuous Integration, and infrastructure solutions across a breadth of platforms and technologies and foster a community while being supported with plentiful training and mentorship opportunities? We’re looking for a Senior Software Engineering Manager who will be responsible for enriching a Cloud Practice within Core Systems Platform (CSP) to accelerate us on Cloud journey through building foundational capabilities/patterns and enabling teams as well as managing the distributed applications from a design, technical architecture and selecting cloud services wisely. Core Responsibilities – Core Systems Platform Cloud Engineering As a manager, evangelize a Cloud Engineering culture and community within CSP As a manager, enable Cloud Engineering teams and guild/practice across CSP Develop existing engineering talent for modern Cloud and DevSecOps practices/solutions Engineer foundational modern Cloud capabilities and empower/enable teams to utilize Develop a CSP Cloud roadmap and track progress against roadmap Coach CSP scrum teams, empowering them on their Cloud and DevSecOps journey Core Responsibilities – Distributed applications on the Cloud Lead the Distributed applications and its teams Lead architecture/design Lead the Distributed applications data management, and migration engineering/operations Lead the Distributed applications (real time and batch) performance, volume, and scalability from engineering, testing, and maintenance perspective Ideal Candidate Will Offer Positive, growth-oriented mindset Hands-on, collaborative, partnering and engineering lead mindset Robust technical acumen on cloud/on-prem DevSecOps software development and technologies Passion for building modular, configurable Cloud and DevSecOps solutions utilizing the latest technologies Empathetic technical leadership and talent development Boundless intellectual curiosity to continually explore how to move better, faster and cheaper Collaborative voice for solution integrity utilizing best practices and industry standards Technical and marketing skills to craft and execute initiatives Robust product management skills and inspiration for DevSecOps/software engineering teams Experience/Qualifications 15+ years of experience developing software products, and 5+ years of managing software engineers Hands on experience engineering/developing modern on-prem/public cloud DevSecOps solutions, Angular, Node Js, Python and Go Expert level experience in relational and NOSQL databases. Willing to learn, go above and beyond attitudes. Experience with modern and legacy development languages Experience with modern and legacy database solutions Strong healthcare domain data experience. Experience with CI/CD tooling and Agile. If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload. At The Cigna Group, we’re dedicated to improving the health and vitality of those we serve. Through our divisions Cigna Healthcare and Evernorth Health Services, we are committed to enhancing the lives of our clients, customers and patients. Join us in driving growth and improving lives. At GCC, employees are our most important resource. As a part of the GCC family, you'll be welcomed into a culture that promotes the company vision and internal career growth. Our company vision is to have our customers recognize us as a business partner that generates the most value to their construction projects. We're a sustainable growing company, a great place to work and a solid investment for our shareholders. GCC is an enterprise with a global and sustainable approach. Our production is mainly devoted to the manufacture and sale of gray Portland cement, mortar, premixed concrete, concrete blocks, plaster, aggregates and other construction materials.

Who we are:

GCC is a world-class company that produces, distributes and markets cement, ready-mixed concrete, aggregates, and innovative products related to the construction industries in Mexico and the United States. We take pride in being a market leader with a culture of innovation, high performance and safety. GCC offers a very competitive benefits program including paid time off, medical, dental, vision, short and long-term disability insurance plans, and a 401K.

What you will do:

Responsible for assuring quality from the production process through delivery of the product and will lead our QC team.
• Implements, upgrades and plans the steps in quality assurance.
• Develops the testing procedures and protocols used in quality assurance programs.
• Review plans and specifications with sales team to determine the best products for the project.
• Designs and provides and/or review and approve project submittal packages for customers.
• Utilize daily KPIs to drive excellence in operations, sales, technical services and customer service.
• Analyzes accuracy of plant batching and provides recommendations for improvement. Performs plant audits of to ensure that plants comply with technical policy.
• Oversee the submittal and qualification process and address any specific project requirements.
• Investigates customer complaints thoroughly and handles responses appropriately.
• Available to assist at the jobsite at any time. Visits job sites to respond to quality control issues and to ensure that Technical Services and Quality Control Standard Operating Procedures are being followed.
• Look for root causes of all problems and utilizes problems as a means of educating field team members about the principles of quality production.
• Provide ongoing education of new products and developments to internal and external customers.
• Be a leader in usage of Operator verification program to improve production and to elimate qualitly complaints.
• Participate in management team meetings and oversee a team of quality control technicians and engineers.
• Contributes to the maintenance of operational policies and procedures including hiring and termination, promotion and determining pay. Responsible for scheduling and performance evaluation.
• Works with the Operations Manager and Plant Managers to ensure optimal production from plants.
• Strive to build deep, lasting relationships with every level of customer organization on projects requiring advanced technical support.
Experience and abilities, you will need:
• Associates or Bachelor's Degree or equivalent combination of experience/education (preferably in Engineering, construction engineer or mining engineer).
• 3-5 years of related experience in aggregate, asphalt and concrete industry (preferred) or relevant quality control management.
• Previous supervisory/management experience preferred.
• Understanding of industry standards and specifications as well as knowledge of ready mix, asphalt, aggregate, manufacturing design, process and equipment.
• Valid Driver's License with acceptable driving record.
• Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions.
• Demonstrated proficiency with personal computer and software packages.
• Demonstrated ability to plan and organize and to work independently.
• Strong Work Ethic: Uses time efficiently and ensures job duties, issues, and concerns are handled in a timely, appropriate manner.
• Integrity: Acts with unyielding integrity and honesty in business transactions, promoting company policies, and holding self-accountable.
• Team Player: Establishes trust with team members, clearly stating expectations and accountabilities of self and others; recognizes the importance of high group morale and acts to protect or build as necessary; collaborates with others to address issues as necessary.
• Lead the QC team by planning, organizing and communicating effectively with the team.
• Ability to work under pressure and availability to work at any given time on any given day.
• Exhibits good interpersonal and customer service skills.
• Must be able to read, write, speak, and understand English.
• Frequent regional travel with occasional overnights
You will love working here because:

At GCC, employees are our most important resource. As a part of the GCC family, you'll be welcomed into a culture that promotes the company vision and internal career growth. Our company vision is to have our customers recognize us as a business partner that generates the most value to their construction projects. We're a sustainable growing company, a great place to work and a solid investment for our shareholders. GCC is an enterprise with a global and sustainable approach. Understanding of industry standards and specifications as well as knowledge of ready mix, asphalt, aggregate, manufacturing design, process and equipment
Valid Driver's License with acceptable driving record
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions
Demonstrated proficiency with personal computer and software packages
Demonstrated ability to plan and organize and to work independently

Integrity: Acts with unyielding integrity and honesty in business transactions, promoting company policies, and holding self-accountable

Lead the QC team by planning, organizing and communicating effectively with the team
Ability to work under pressure and availability to work at any given time on any given day
Exhibits good interpersonal and customer service skills

Frequent regional travel with occasional overnights
Responsibilities: Responsible for assuring quality from the production process through delivery of the product and will lead our QC team
Implements, upgrades and plans the steps in quality assurance
Develops the testing procedures and protocols used in quality assurance programs

data.job_description:
Hiring Department

University Stores

Job Description

Summary

To oversee and direct computer sales and related service activities at multiple store locations throughout the state, including sales and promotions, operations, personnel management, financial performance, loss prevention, and computer and related peripherals, devices, and supplies buying. Execute goals in support of regional strategies to achieve sales, service, customer satisfaction, profitability, and operational goals.

Key Responsibilities

Oversee merchandising and inventory control of computers, peripherals, devices, and related supplies. Establish visual merchandise standards and physical departmental layout and design expectations. Oversee special services and customer ordering processes including electronic and web site orders.

Monitor and control expenses, purchases, and inventory levels. Ensure proper inventory control including price changes, inventory levels, and shrinkage; and timely and efficient return of unsold products.

Monitor store budgets. Review financial reports, analyze trends, detect errors, and improve business practices to meet budget.

Develop and provide analytical reports and information.

Communicate with contacts to build professional relationships and partnerships, understand and respond to customer needs, and promote technology solutions on all campuses as a strategic partner in the academic community.

Direct, arrange, and participate in meetings or conferences with vendors, publishers, distributors, wholesalers, faculty, staff, and students, or other interested parties.

Oversee planning, developing, and sales promotion activities. Develop new ways to promote the department. Utilize co-op funds and work closely with the marketing department as necessary.

Plan and initiate necessary preparations for rush and buyback business cycles, including staff and product stock levels.

Develop, recommend, implement, and maintain departmental policies and procedures.

Participate in strategic planning or initiative development. Utilize benchmark studies comprised of like institutions to develop and compare performance measures, best practices, and assist in planning and setting goals.

Maintain knowledge of point of sale/computerized inventory control system. Train and assist employees in the usage and capabilities of the system; troubleshoot and provide answers as necessary; ensure consistency of data entered into the system, and conduct on-going reviews of standards and overall analysis of data.

Perform retail manager responsibilities including opening and closing the store, participating in the weekend manager rotation schedule, and attending regular manager meetings.

Promote appropriate employee and customer safety, and product security activities. Assist campus police and support personnel in investigations of theft or personal injury, identify cause and implement the means to avoid future incidents.

Assist with loss prevention, participate in store-wide or division wide committees, develop and submit quarterly and annual reports, provide on-going analysis of the department, and ensure communication and cooperation with all University Stores departments.

Administer all University policies governing employment in coordination with principal and local Human Resource offices. Ensure supporting management personnel actively support University diversity initiatives, properly communication policies, and promote a collegial work environment supportive of local retail operations and objectives.

Recruit, select, train, supervise, evaluate and discipline staff. Provide leadership to and motivation and direction for staff through coaching, training (direct/indirect) and supervision.

Plan, assign and review work of staff.

Develop and oversee employee training and development programming; in coordination with Human Resource representatives, source or develop retail, technical and management training programs and arrange for their presentation, employee attendance and assessment.

Maintain a level of expertise in the computer resale industry. Participate in industry committees.

Salary

Salary Range: $55,208 - $72,000

Grade: GGS 011

University Title: ASSOCIATE DIRECTOR BUSINESS ADMINISTRATION

Internal applicants can determine their university title by accessing the Talent Profile tile in myHR.

Shift

8:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m.

Monday through Friday with some evenings and weekends

Minimum Qualifications

A Bachelor's degree or an equivalent combination of education and experience and at least 5 years of experience from which comparable knowledge and skills can be acquired is necessary

Benefit Eligibility

This position is eligible for University benefits. The University offers a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental and vision plans, retirement, paid time off, and educational fee discounts. For additional information on University benefits, please visit the Faculty & Staff Benefits website at http://www.umsystem.edu/totalrewards/benefits

Values Commitment

We value the uniqueness of every individual and strive to ensure each person’s success. Contributions from individuals with diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives promote intellectual pluralism and enable us to achieve the excellence that we seek in learning, research and engagement. This commitment makes our university a better place to work, learn and innovate.

In your application materials, please discuss your experiences and expertise that support these values and enrich our missions of teaching, research and engagement.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Equal Opportunity is and shall be provided for all employees and applicants for employment on the basis of their demonstrated ability and competence without unlawful discrimination on the basis of their race, color, national origin, ancestry, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, disability, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable state or federal law. This policy shall not be interpreted in such a manner as to violate the legal rights of religious organizations or the recruiting rights of military organizations associated with the Armed Forces or the Department of Homeland Security of the United States of America. For more information, call the Director of Employee and Labor Relations at 573-882-7976.

To request ADA accommodations, please call the Director of Accessibility and ADA at 573-884-7278.

Know Your Rights

To read more about Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) please use the following links:
• Know Your Rights English Version
• Know Your Rights Spanish Version

data.job_description:
Contribute. Grow. Lead...with OxyChem. Looking for a challenge? Desire to achieve your true potential? OxyChem is a growing, action-oriented, safety driven chemical manufacturing company continually striving to be the best in the business while staying focused on environmental protection. The secret to our success has and will continue to be our people.

Occidental Chemical Corporation (OxyChem) is a leading North American manufacturer of polyvinyl chloride (PVC) resins, chlorine and caustic soda – key building blocks for a variety of indispensable products such as plastics, pharmaceuticals and water treatment chemicals. Other OxyChem products include caustic potash, chlorinated organics, sodium silicates, chlorinated isocyanurates and calcium chloride. OxyChem's market position is among the top three producers in the United States in 2020 for the principal products it manufactures and markets. Based in Dallas, Texas, the company has manufacturing facilities in the U.S., Canada and Latin America.

In a fast-paced industry that demands precision, we create a supportive workplace where the safety and well-being of our employees are paramount. We are committed to rewarding top performers, offering very competitive pay and benefits, and providing tremendous career development opportunities. We are looking for an experienced and self-motivated individual to fill the position of Technical Manager within our Pasadena PVC Plant located in Pasadena, TX.

Responsibilities
• Maintain protection of the environment and the health and safety of our employees, customers, and the communities in which we operate and/or transport our products as our highest priority.
• Manages and provides leadership for the Logistics, Quality Laboratory, Project Engineering, Process Engineering and Process Controls Engineering departments for Houston PVC manufacturing.
• Identify, evaluate, develop, specify, justify, install, and start-up process improvements to increase production capacity, improve operating reliability, reduce manufacturing costs, reduce energy usage, conserve raw materials, improve product yields and improve product quality.
• Participate in any opportunity to enhance safety, upgrade environmental safeguards, and provide for the overall optimization of process operation.
• Provide ongoing engineering assistance to operations including troubleshooting of process operating problems, conducting special tests, developing reports, providing technical assistance as required and reporting of production status.
• Provide coordination between the Production, Project, Maintenance and Corporate Engineering Departments regarding capital project engineering, scope development and execution, including preparation of AFE’s.
• Represent and/or assist production and engineering in matters of evaluation, selection and coordination and control of vendors supplying necessary operating services, consulting services, materials, equipment and other needs of operation.
Qualifications
• Bachelor’s Degree in Chemical Engineering with a minimum 10-15 years of engineering experience in manufacturing environment. PVC technical experience preferred.
• Strong analytical/problem solving skills.
• Extensive working knowledge of Process Safety Management systems.
• High proficiency in Microsoft applications (such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• Ability to read, write and speak in English.
• Excellent interpersonal skills including the ability to work as part of a team.
• Ability to work weekends, holidays and respond to callouts on a non-routine basis.

Physical Requirements
• Must be able to lift 40 lbs., climb ladders and stairs. Walking, bending, stooping is required.
• Must be able to wear personal protective equipment including the use of a respirator.
• Must be able to respond to visual and audible alarms.

Additional Desired Qualifications
• Good working knowledge of SAP.

Occidental is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, marital status, political preference, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

data.job_description:
Array is looking for a Technical Project Manager to join our team to lead our squads on the development and rollout of important engineering work. You will report to the Technical Program Director. As a Technical Project Manager, you'll work with multiple team members at different levels of the organization to manage technology projects. You will also be foundational; you will help define the role of Project Management at Array and help shape related procedures.

Department Defining Activities:
• Recommend improvements to established business processes while continuing to deliver high value in execution
• Solidify the project team as the main communicator for project progress and details
• Define project department's role-type
• Given project management's role type, build more mature PM processes where needed

You Will:
• Be the Agile coach/consultant to help empower delivery teams to be successful in their work
• Monitor performance metrics to understand where roadblocks or bottlenecks exist for delivery teams to empower them to implement changes to help them be successful
• Manage multiple concurrent complex projects
• Work with important partners to develop a clear understanding of a business need, define the project goals, and ensure understanding of strategic goals
• Work with delivery team on deliverable tracking and impediments/delays
• Apply project management tools/techniques
• Guide project-related change management
• Manage multiple partners, aligning on common goals and communicating risks; run meetings
• Maintain project plans, identify resource needs, and manage project schedule
• Build relationships of trust throughout the company and organizations; collaborate across teams to define strategy, goals and commitment to timelines
• Anticipate the needs, risks, and challenges of your projects
• Develop creative and practical solutions based on evaluation of multiple factors
• Deliver value by leading project teams and by creating collaboration with team members, partners, and other Project Managers
• Drive projects forward amid stalling forces

You Have:
• 3+ years of experience managing complex project simultaneously (either IT infrastructure, application development, business process, etc) through teams working within a software development environment or hardware implementation cycle
• 3+ years of experience managing multiple concurrent projects with diverse working groups with an eye toward project dependencies
• 5+ years of experience in project/program management, requirements definition and/or deployment of business requirements to information systems
• Agile methodology knowledge and practice
• Working knowledge of the components of the software release process, including issues of development, documentation, and quality assurance
• Ability to adapt and identify/lead definition in areas of change
• Predict challenges and head-off obstacles
• Meet delivery timelines

Pay Transparency:

Salary Range: $93,000 - $117,000

The pay range above represents the current low and high end of the compensation band for this position and may change in the future. Actual compensation may vary depending on factors such as candidate skills, qualifications and experience. Other compensation may include equity options and incentives.

Array focuses on Financial Services, Technology, Finance Technology, and Early Stage IT. Their company has offices in New York City and Remote. They have a large team that's between 201-500 employees.

You can view their website at https://www.array.com/ or find them on LinkedIn.

data.job_title: Senior Manager, Development Engineering - DG, Solar
data.job_description:
The Senior Manager, Development Engineering - DG, Solar will need to have specific expertise in the optimal development and deployment of engaged distributed generation technologies, including solar, PV and other emerging technologies. The duties are to provide technical expertise and guidance to Sales & Origination efforts to qualify early-stage DG solar & PV opportunities.

Responsibilities
• Cultivating effective business relationships with target customers and communicate full scope of solutions and services to meet customer business goals and achieve Distributed Generation business plan objectives.
• Assess and develop technical solutions for DG solar & storage opportunities originated by internal Sales or proposed by external channel partners. Activities include solar and storage performance modeling, customer savings analysis and determination of commercial viability.
• Lead and manage all aspects of project development team to meet client and business plan expectations and objectives, including but not limited to technical, regulatory, real estate, environmental, and governmental approvals.
• Utilize diligence feedback and information to development project capital budgets, operating budgets, spending forecasts, system performance projections, and estimates on the applicability of available incentives. Work with Finance to appropriately apply resultant technical information into project finance models in a manner consistent with contract documents and in accordance with company guidelines.
• Lead, coordinate, originate and/or manage the development and negotiation of customer and subcontractor contracts during the project development process, including but not limited to master service agreements, EPC agreements, consulting services agreements, power purchase agreements, purchase and sale agreements, letters of intent, teaming agreements, and memos of understanding.
• Effectively communicate with decision makers and customer representatives to develop positive relationships to secure new business opportunities, interface and coordinate with all project stakeholders.
• Promote business activity by coordinating, developing and presenting concepts and technical findings, at varying levels of the project development process.
• Support the promotion, education and communication of Brookfield energy products and services to developers, technology partners, customers and service providers.
• Maintain a thorough knowledge and recognition of engineering and construction standards, specifications, applicable codes and ordinances, regulations and rules and service rules and policies.
• Develop and oversee processes, rules, and policies to ensure compliance with applicable Brookfield policies, standards and specifications.
• Travel, as required (valid driver’s license at all times).

Qualifications
• Undergraduate four-year degree in technical field (engineering, technology, sciences or mathematics), or equivalent work experience
• Minimum of 5 years of project development experience required in distributed generation market with solar or other renewable technology.
• Minimum of 3 years of experience developing and/or deploying storage assets.
• Strong client-focus with well-developed customer relations skills; customer-facing and ability to represent the organization in a professional manner
• Well experienced utilize MS tool such as Excel, Word, Power Point, etc
• Fundamental understanding of the technical, financial and contractual aspects of the Distributed Generation business
• Proven ability to work well through sales and development process in support of and/or leading project completion, transaction and closure.
• Ability to manage multiple tasks and strict timelines
• Excellent decision making, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills
• Proven ability to independently drive technical and commercial results in a team-oriented environment.
• Ability to write and comprehend technical contracts
• Ability to write presentations, proposals, and technical reports
• Ability to identify project viability from the perspective of technical scope, financial and legal
• Ability to develop subcontractor/vendor relationships and regional strategic partnerships for specific projects
• Well-developed written and verbal communication skills
• Strong interpersonal, problem-solving, analytical and team leadership skills
• Team-oriented and ability to work with a diverse workforce

Company Description:

Infostretch is a digital-first technology services firm backed by Goldman Sachs Asset Management and Everstone Capital. We specialize in accelerating business transformation and delivering human-centric digital experiences. For over 17 years, has been meeting customers wherever they are in the digital lifecycle and helping them outperform their competition through speed and innovation.

Position Opening

Job title: Technical Manager-IT

Job location: Santa Clara, CA and unanticipated client sites across the US. Must be willing to travel and/or relocate domestically.

Number of positions: 1 opening.

Offered Salary: $160,389 Per year

Job duration: Permanent position, Full time, Mon - Fri, 40 hours per week.

Job Description: Manage and oversee the end-to-end project management activities such as project reporting, project planning, issue/risk identification tracking, and scope management. Liaise with cross functional teams & guide work of technical staff providing solution support/enhancements using Java, VB Script, Microsoft Visio, SOAP UI, Shell Scripting, Unix, Confluence, JIRA, Oracle SQL. Facilitate project reviews & other Scrum-related activities using Agile methodologies

data.job_description:
Job Description

At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We're committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that's welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.

The Boeing Defense, Space and Security (BDS), Ground Development and Mission Operations Division, is seeking a Senior Ground Engineering Manager (Level M) to join our team in El Segundo, CA, Huntington Beach, CA, or Fairfax, VA. Our team creates the next generation products and services for the BDS business unit. We work with proprietary customers in the development of the next-generation technologies in space. The teamfocuses on rapid prototyping to demonstrate a host of mission-focused technologies for a variety of customers. Our group works all facets of engineering from technology investment, concept development, proposal writing, requirements and design, build, integration, test, and demonstration of products in their relevant environments.

The Senior Grounds Systems Manager will lead, manage, develop and motivate an integrated team of multiple discipline engineers with diverse backgrounds and skill levels in developing key ground technology solutions for customer needs in El Segundo, CA, Huntington Beach, CA or Fairfax, VA. This manager shall develop and execute project and process plans, implement policies and procedures and sets operational goals, acquire resources for projects and processes, provides technical management of suppliers and leads process improvements, develop and maintain relationships and partnerships with customers, stakeholders, peers, partners and direct reports, provides oversight and approval of technical approaches, products and processes. This position requires demonstrated experience in quantum technologies, high-fidelity digital twin technologies, a diverse background of project management experience, and the clear exhibition of superior judgment and decision making to engineer new solutions and support existing capabilities. Demonstrated strategic and critical thinking skills and exceptional troubleshooting capabilities are required.

The successful candidate will be responsible for the integrated planning, strategy development, program/project management and technical oversight of a portfolio composed of multiple research, development, prototyping or demonstration projects, each intended to develop future, next generation capabilities for Boeing.

Position Responsibilities:

Responsible for a portfolio (i.e., multiple) ground programs to include Disruptive Computing & Networks (DC&N) quantum technology research projects, involving:
• Budget planning and execution.
• Staffing - identify ground engineering staffing needs, develop staffing plan, hire and staff personnel, and perform onboarding.
• Strategy development, alignment, execution, and communication.
• Ensure development of unique Design Practices in alignment with Ground Engineering capability.
• Monitor and manage program performance, resolving technical and program issues, controlling configurations, and maintaining metrics.
• Develop, adapt, and implement appropriate processes / procedures to ensure high quality output of all projects and disseminate as appropriate throughout DC&N .

Act as Responsible Manager for Ground Engineering, supporting Ground Capability horizontal integration of personnel resources:
• Develop division program specific Ground Strategy and integrate support development of division Ground Strategy Plan.
• Coordinate program and division activities with support organizations, ensure successful collaboration to further project objectives, including at a minimum:
• Finance Supplier Management.
• IT Communications.
• 'Legal (and IPM) Facilities.
• Government Operations Global Engagement.

Ensure effective interactions with Business Units and Enterprise:
• Articulate strategy, programmatic objectives, and technical capabilities under development.
• Identify high leverage opportunities for Ground Engineering projects to address Business Unit challenges, limitations, or constraints.
• Ensure insertion of Ground engineering technologies and future capabilities onto strategic roadmaps.
• Develop, negotiate, and ensure success of specific technology transitions between ground projects and Business Unit programs.

Ensure effective collaboration with current and future business partners:
• Manage supplier relationships to ensure successful project execution.
• Develop relationships with potential future business partners/suppliers.
• Construct effective agreements with business partners to meet strategic objectives.

Ensure effective communications with government customers:
• Shape future contracted research and development efforts.
• Position Boeing to be competitive for future efforts.
• Develop good working relationships with government decision makers in areas of relevance for Ground Engineering.

Champion employee recognition, increase employee satisfaction and ensure workplace safety.

This position is expected to be 100% onsite. The selected candidate will be required to work onsite at one of the listed location options.

This position requires active U.S. Top Secret/SCI Security Clearance (U.S. Citizenship Required). An ability to obtain an adjudicated CI (Counter Intelligence) polygraph will be required post start.

Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):
• Bachelor, Master or Doctorate of Science degree from an accredited course of study, in Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or other technical degree.
• 10+ years of experience working in Project/program management.
• 10+years of experience leading cross-functional engineering teams.
• 10+ years of experience and technical leadership on a development and production programs.

•

Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience)
• Active CI Polygraph.
• 10+ years of experience in performing satellite ground system and/or subsystem systems engineering.
• 5+ years of systems or software engineering experience on space-based systems.
• Experience withquantum information science and technology as well as familiar with related engineering disciplines such as mechanical, thermal, electrical, computer, and systems engineering.

Relocation:

This position offers relocation based on candidate eligibility.

Drug Free Workplace:

Boeingis a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.

Shift:

This position is for 1st shift.

At Boeing, we strive to deliver a Total Rewards package that will attract, engage and retain the top talent. Elements of the Total Rewards package include competitive base pay and variable compensation opportunities.

The Boeing Company also provides eligible employees with an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and a number of programs that provide for both paid and unpaid time away from work.

The specific programs and options available to any given employee may vary depending on eligibility factors such as geographic location, date of hire, and the applicability of collective bargaining agreements.

data.job_description:
At CEC Entertainment, we build careers around great food, family, and fun! Our purpose and our passion is to create the best place for kids and families to eat and play!

Job Description

At Chuck E. Cheese, we build careers around great food, family and fun! Our purpose and passion is to create the best place for kids and families to eat and play!

If it's broke can you fix it? If it blinks, buzzes or beeps do you know how to keep it blinking, buzzing and beeping? Do you have a knack for all things mechanical, electrical and technological?? If so, you would be an awesome Game Room Technician! This position is known internally as Technical Manager.

Technology is at the heart of the Chuck E. Cheese (CEC) experience and we need your electro-mechanical, equipment maintenance and troubleshooting experience. We need top talent who can think on their feet and adapt on the fly. Military veterans, we're looking for you!

Chuck E. Cheese offers great work-life balance with no early mornings or late, late nights. There are multiple opportunities for advancement, competitive benefits, 401(k), paid vacation and paid professional training to take your tech and management skills to the next level. Oh, and work today, get paid tomorrow!

Chuck E. Cheese now offers access to earned wages with our NEW "Work Today, Get Paid Tomorrow" program. Don't wait between paychecks anymore!

What You'll Do:
• Oversee and be responsible for the latest in working on the latest video and skill games, kitchen equipment, register systems and coin and ticket mechanisms
• Oversee and be responsible for the latest arcade games, register and IT systems and ticket dispensers
• Manage the electrical and mechanical aspects of the game room; perform daily preventative maintenance and repairs
• Troubleshoot, repair and/or replace defective electronic components, boards and computers
• Operate stage show equipment and manage repairs and preventative maintenance, including compressor operation, lighting and sound, pneumatics, mac valves, cylinders, boards and stage show cosmetics
• Maintain an inventory of electronic equipment, mechanical parts and tools
• Maintain a budget
• Maintain a safety-focused attitude at all times

Skills We're Looking For:
• Ability to read schematics and troubleshoot down to the component board level
• Planning, organization and multi-tasking skills
• Attention to detail
• Time management and a sense of urgency
• Military experience, a technical degree, or previous electrical or mechanical training, preferred

Minimum Qualifications:
• Must be at least 18 years of age
• Must be able to work up to 45 hours per week
• Must have a high school diploma or GED; or equivalent combination of relevant education and experience

Essential Job Functions and Work Environment:
• Must be able to lift or carry objects weighing 0-50 pounds during scheduled shift.
• Must be able to stand, bend, kneel, reach, push/pull, walk and squat during scheduled shift.
• In addition to the essential job responsibilities stated above, the ability to handle job stress and interact effectively with others, including guests and Team members, are essential functions of the job.
• The work environment includes flashing and flickering lights, moving mechanical parts, and loud noise. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

The Company;

CEC Entertainment, LLC ("CEC"), headquartered in Irving, Texas is the nationally recognized leader in family entertainment and dining with its Chuck E. Cheese, Peter Piper Pizza brands and virtual kitchen concept, Pasqually's Pizza & Wings.

As the place where half a million happy birthdays are celebrated every year, Chuck E. Cheese's goal is to create positive, lifelong memories for families through fun, food, and play and is the place Where a Kid Can Be a Kid. Committed to providing a fun, safe environment, Chuck E. Cheese helps protect families through industry-leading programs such as Kid Check. As a strong advocate for its local communities, Chuck E. Cheese has donated more than $19 million schools through its fundraising programs. Peter Piper Pizza features dining, entertainment and carryout with a neighbor-hood pizzeria feel and "pizza made fresh, families made happy" culture.

Peter Piper Pizza takes pride in delivering quality food and fun that reconnects family and friends. Created in 2020, Pasqually's Pizza & Wings offers a distinct, customized eating experience outside of a restaurant environment that amplifies classic pizza and wings and operates out of 400 ghost locations nationwide. The Company and its franchise operate a system of nearly 600 Chuck E. Cheese and more than 120 Peter Piper Pizza venues, with locations in 47 states and 17 foreign countries and territories. For more information, visit chuckecheese.com, pasquallyspizza.com, and peterpiperpizza.com.

Benefits:

CEC Entertainment offers a wide variety of benefits including medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and 401(k) retirement savings plan to eligible U.S. employees as part of their overall employment package. We also offer job training and career growth opportunities. Chuck E. Cheese is a "Work Today, Get Paid Tomorrow" employer.
• * *

At CEC Entertainment, we believe that our workforce should reflect the diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives of many guests we serve. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we do not discriminate against applicants due to race, ancestry, color, genetics, gender identify, gender ex-pression, sexual orientation, national origin, religion, age, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, veteran status, or on the basis of any other federal, state or local protected class.
