About Our Client

My client is an industry leader in Healthcare Logistics. Founded in 2000, they've grown their business to operate in 32 states and are currently doing $300M in revenue year over year.

Their Engineering team is looking for a Technical Manager help build the tools that allow us to deliver our products to more people and drive their growth. As a Technical Manager, you will be in the weeds coding and building out the platform while reporting into the VP of Engineering and overseeing 2 direct reports. This role will be Front-End for the first year and candidates proficient in Angular are preferred. Following year one, this role will move into a full stack capacity operating in SalesForce on the backend.

You'll be responsible for a brand new B2B web portal that operates on Angular, Mulesoft, and Salesforce. The portal will be self-testing with zero-downtime deployment. The ideal candidate must be passionate about building products from the very early stages and will have ideally been a key contributor on a team that has built out an enterprise portal.

This is a hybrid role, with commute to the office expected 2x per month.
Job Description
• Develop solutions using Angular
• You will contribute to development, design and test automation best practices and procedures.
• This is Full-stack development position. Including data modeling/database, middleware, Front End UI, web-services, and deployment.
• Build next-generation web portals that are fast and responsive.
• Develop solutions in Salesforce technology
• Collaborate with onshore & offshore developers, Database developers to deliver integrated solution.
• Contribute to important team culture and contribute code to efforts across a fast-growing company
• Support, maintain and upgrade code and participate in implementation of a complex system
• Evaluate and recommend software technologies in these areas, evaluate alternatives and analyze problems with data infrastructures
• Oversee and develop 2 direct reports

MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.
The Successful Applicant
• 5-7 years of Angular experience
• Relevant experience in React or Vue will be considered
• Experience working on a team that has built out enterprise portals
• 4+ years of Back End developments in an Object Oriented language (C#/Java)
• A self-motivated individual who works well with little direction
• Cloud hosting, monitoring, performance tuning, and optimization experience is preferred
• Has excellent communication skills
• Love making and building things as part of a growing team
• Experience mentoring more junior developers
• Salesforce experience is a plus but not required
• Mulesoft experience is a plus but not required
• This is a hybrid role; candidates are expected to be able to reliably to commute to office in Chicago suburbs 2x per month
• Please note, my client is unable to provide sponsorship at this time.
What's on Offer
• Salary up to $160k, based on experience and interviews
• 8% yearly bonus
• Health insurance with HSA
• 3 weeks of PTO to start + company holidays
• 401k with company match
• Employee Assistance Program
• Health, Dental, Vision
• Unlimited growth; this person will be the lead in building out a brand new greenfield development
• Direct access to the leadership team

data.job_description:
P&G is the largest consumer packaged goods company in the world. We have operations in over 75 countries, with 65 trusted brands that improve lives for 5 billion consumers worldwide. This brings many advantages, including the opportunity for our employees to enjoy a diverse and rewarding lifelong career filled with new and exciting challenges.

We believe great ideas emerge from the creative connections that happen between our hardworking employees, and we encourage diverse, multi-functional teams to work together to generate new ideas to address challenges we face. P&G has positions available at various technical centers and plants (including Cincinnati) across the United States.

We are seeking a highly motivated leader who will make a difference if the life of others by improving the life of customers through the innovative products offered at Procter & Gamble. In this role you will provide Engineering leadership and support to Procter and Gamble (P&G) site via technical mastery and site-specific coaching. This role is key to keeping P&G as the top producer of consumer goods in the world. The successful individual will be flexible with their working capability to meet P&G expectations, lead various action plan focus items, and implement innovative programs.

In this role you will build an engineering mastery. Provides support on;
• Engineering matters for the Business Unit and R&D innovation projects and initiatives
• Site engineering issues and problems
• Innovation of new and current product lines offered by the company.

Responsible for completing tasks that can range from the creating of a new product line to the development of new packages, the testing of new materials and the conversion of process to pave the way of the future.

Qualifications
• Bachelor or Master's degree in and Engineering , Material Sciences, or Computer Science.
• Ability to travel 10%-25% of the time
• Willing to relocate throughout the career
• 0-3 years of experience

What we offer:

Responsibilities as of Day 1 _ you will feel the ownership of your project from the beginning, and you will be given specific projects and responsibilities.

Continuous mentorship - you will work with passionate people and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager. Work and be part of a dynamic and encouraging environment - working over a diverse array of interesting problems.

Promote agility and work/life effectiveness and your long-term well-being.

Competitive salary and benefits package.

Starting Salary: $85K-$115K

Compensation for roles at P&G varies depending on a wide array of non-discriminatory factors including but not limited to the specific office location, role, degree/credentials, relevant skill set, and level of relevant experience. At P&G compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. Total rewards at P&G include salary + bonus (if applicable) + benefits. Your recruiter may be able to share more about our total rewards offerings and the specific salary range for the relevant location(s) during the hiring process.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, marital status, citizenship, HIV/AIDS status or any other legally protected factor.

Immigration sponsorship is not available for this role. As a general matter, Procter & Gamble does not sponsor candidates for nonimmigrant visas or permanent residency. However, Procter & Gamble may make exceptions on a discretionary basis. Any exceptions would be based on the Company's specific business needs at the time and place of recruitment as well as the particular qualifications of the individual.

Procter & Gamble participates in e-verify as required by law.

Qualified individuals will not be disadvantaged based on being unemployed.

Ability to travel 10%-25% of the time

data.job_title: Tech Engineer / Tech Manager - MEP - Construction - 100% traveling role - can live anywhere in the US
data.job_description:
Overview

Technical Managers have extensive technical engineering experience, and have completed more complex, demanding or larger-value projects of various types. Technical Engineers act as technical experts for a specific discipline to insure all related construction activities are performed in accordance with accepted professional standards. They work to solve complex technical field-related problems, and manage the equipment startup and commissioning process (V-Start). They assist in the implementation of the project’s 4-phase quality control plan, and monitor field construction of mechanical and / or electrical subcontractors for schedule management and conformance to contract documents.

We want you to join our team.

Through industry-leading innovation our company has forged a legacy of quality and safety since our founding in 1916.

What we offer:
• Career planning, development & growth
• Outstanding training programs

Why Walbridge:
• Large organization with award-winning projects, yet small enough for you to have an impact
• Strong values which are the foundation of our growth for over 100 years
• International, regional and local recognition for stand-out projects, safety, sustainability, culture, wellness and diversity practices

Location:

This position can be based out of any Walbridge office, or you can live in any US city if you are able to travel 100%.

Responsibilities
• Provide technical support during design and preconstruction to assist owner and Architect Engineer.
• Manage Equipment start up turnaround process V-Start (KAN-BAN)
• Assist in the implementation of the project’s QC Planning and inspection process.
• Monitor Field Construction of Electrical / Mechanical subcontractors for schedule management and conformance to contract documents.
• Provide expert technical support to company personnel as required to resolve field construction or similar problems. May include interpretation of codes, design of specialty equipment, etc.
• Develop, issue and maintain general instructions and guidelines for field construction methods utilizing current industry and company practices.
• Develop and maintain current work controlling documents which set mandatory minimum requirements for work, authority, documentation and record requirements in accordance with applicable codes and contract requirements.
• Review A/E specifications, bid inquiries, etc. to insure technical and code requirements for material, equipment and field activities are met.
• Continuously research, evaluate, and recommend implementation of new (or improved) construction processes, equipment, material, techniques and methods as technology improves.
• Participate in constructability reviews of design documents to help determine most cost effective and schedule efficient method of construction.
• Manage Equipment start up and turnover process V-Start (KAN-BAN)
• Provides technical input to company functions such as estimating, controls, project management or other areas.

Qualifications
• High school diploma or equivalent. Mechanical / Electrical Engineering degrees a plus.
• Professional industry training and experience.
• Minimum of five years extensive experience related to mechanical and / or Electrical discipline. Thorough knowledge of all aspects of discipline construction technology, equipment, materials, methods, etc., required.
• Proficiency in problem solving and written/verbal communications skills essential.
• Computer literate in a wide variety of applications including web based project management systems.
• Ability to accept project assignments that may require extended long term temporary living arrangements or frequent travel to non-local job sites.

Job Competencies:
SafetyTechnical SkillsPlanning & SchedulingRisk ManagementChange ManagementQuality Control & ISOLean Understanding & ImplementationAdministration & CommunicationInnovation & TechnologyCost Participation & ControlLeadership

EEO/AA Employer M/F/D/V

Walbridge is an equal opportunity employer with a culture that promotes diversity in the workforce. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, sex, religion, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship status, status as an individual with a disability, military, or protected veteran status or any other legally protected status. We prohibit discrimination in decisions concerning career development, recruitment, hiring, compensation, benefits, training, termination, promotions, or any other condition of employment.

Thorough knowledge of all aspects of discipline construction technology, equipment, materials, methods, etc., required
Proficiency in problem solving and written/verbal communications skills essential
Computer literate in a wide variety of applications including web based project management systems
Ability to accept project assignments that may require extended long term temporary living arrangements or frequent travel to non-local job sites

SafetyTechnical SkillsPlanning & SchedulingRisk ManagementChange ManagementQuality Control & ISOLean Understanding & ImplementationAdministration & CommunicationInnovation & TechnologyCost Participation & ControlLeadership

data.job_description:
Description:The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.
At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our outstanding skills, talents and experiences to craft and build solutions to some of the world’s hardest engineering problems. Do you want to be part of a culture that inspires employees to envision the impossible, perform with excellence and build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus—if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

Looking for a career challenge that contributes to one of our Nation’s most critical missions? Interested in managing a complex and dynamic system? If you answered yes to these questions, then we would like you to consider a role as a Systems Engineering Manager on the Flight Operations Support (FOS) engineering team in Sunnyvale. In this role, you will lead a team of 20+ engineers responsible for maintaining the state of health of the Space Based Infrared System (SBIRS) GEO and HEO constellations, while growing the team to perform similar functions for the future Next Generation GEO (NGG) constellation.
Responsibilities include proactive management of on-orbit SBIRS assets by actively engaging in anomaly resolution, trending analysis, project engineering, workload prioritization, change integration, subsystem management, optimization and representing Flight Ops Support Team to both customers and visitors. Must be willing to support mission needs when necessary, inclusive of being available 24x7. This leadership position also requires occasional CONUS travel.
In this role, you will:
• Lead the Program's SBIRS Factory Flight Operations Support (FOS) engineering efforts to include technical direction, planning, and staffing
• Work collaboratively with other FOS managers to coordinate shared resources to accomplish overall program goals.
• Capitalize on your technical background and functional leadership experience to help deliver on all programs that FOS supports.
• Provide Cost Account Manager (CAM) inputs and manage to cost targets and budget allocations
• Support proposals and follow-on contract development.
• Responsible for coordinating subordinate employee recruitment, selection, training, performance assessment, work assignments, salary, and recognition/disciplinary actions.
• Participate in setting priorities and managing schedules.

To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin cultivates an inclusive work environment that inspires differences and big-picture thinking.
Learn more about Lockheed Martin’s competitive and comprehensive benefits package.
Basic Qualifications:
• 4-year technical degree or equivalent experience/combined education
• 7 years minimum of Satellite operations experience in Satellite or Systems Conops Development, Command Product Development, ATLO, Systems Test, Project Engineering, Systems/Subsystems Engineering or on-shift engineering positions
• Willingness to stand recall alternating weeks and aperiodic shift work for rehearsals, launch and engineering activities
• DOD Security clearance level required to start and ability to obtain a TS/SCI
Desired Skills:
• Experience with conducting Factory sustainment activities for on-orbit assets – trending, analysis, and anomaly resolution.
• 3 years in a lead or management role
• Familiarity managing and integration of Systems and Subsystems engineering staff
• Familiarity with command products and procedures required to launch and operate satellite systems
• Experience participating in launch readiness activities, experience participating in launch and early orbit test campaigns
• Experience with staffing selection and performance assessments, consistent with HR and established processes.
• Experience with establishing and communicating team expectations, goals, and objectives
• Experience on-ramping Digital Transformation upgrades and championing process improvements
• Leadership experience developing engineering skillsets, maintaining critical skills, knowledge retention, cultivating a team environment and motivating the workforce
• Excellent communication skills to coordinate and resolve issues across programs that affect customer, subcontracts, operations issues, software and test bed projects, identify risks and appropriate mitigation plans
• Collaborate with government and customer representatives in support of critical space-based operations and distributed multi-element deliveries and activities
• Lead and perform technical planning, system integration, validation, cost and risk, and supportability and effectiveness analyses for total systems
• Experience interacting with multiple engineering disciplines with Hardware/Software integration preferred
• Excellent interpersonal skills
• Familiarity with Cost Account Management (CAM) work, Earned Value Management (EVM) and program planning
Security Clearance Statement: This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration.
Clearance Level: Secret
Other Important Information You Should Know
Expression of Interest: By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings.
Ability to Work Remotely: Onsite Full-time: The work associated with this position will be performed onsite at a designated Lockheed Martin facility.
Work Schedules: Lockheed Martin supports a variety of alternate work schedules that provide additional flexibility to our employees. Schedules range from standard 40 hours over a five day work week while others may be condensed. These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits.
Schedule for this Position: 9x80 every other Friday off
Pay Rate:
The annual base salary range for this position in California or New York City is $135,800 - $256,000. Please note that the salary information is a general guideline only. Lockheed Martin considers factors such as (but not limited to) scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate’s work experience, education/ training, key skills as well as market and business considerations when extending an offer.

Benefits offered: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, 401(k) match, Flexible Spending Accounts, EAP, Education Assistance, Parental Leave, Paid time off, and Holidays.

This position is incentive plan eligible.
Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.
At Lockheed Martin, we use our passion for purposeful innovation to help keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. Our people are some of the greatest minds in the industry and truly make Lockheed Martin a great place to work.

With our employees as our priority, we provide diverse career opportunities designed to propel, develop, and boost agility. Our flexible schedules, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits enable our employees to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work. We place an emphasis on empowering our employees by fostering an inclusive environment built upon integrity and corporate responsibility.

If this sounds like a culture you connect with, you’re invited to apply for this role. Or, if you are unsure whether your experience aligns with the requirements of this position, we encourage you to search on Lockheed Martin Jobs, and apply for roles that align with your qualifications.
Experience Level: Experienced Professional
Business Unit: SPACE
Relocation Available: Possible

Shift: First

7 years minimum of Satellite operations experience in Satellite or Systems Conops Development, Command Product Development, ATLO, Systems Test, Project Engineering, Systems/Subsystems Engineering or on-shift engineering positions
Willingness to stand recall alternating weeks and aperiodic shift work for rehearsals, launch and engineering activities

data.job_description:
CASINO TECHNICAL MANAGER
Jersey City, NJ

About Us

We are BetMGM. We are revolutionizing sports betting and online gaming in the United States. We are a partnership between two powerhouse organizations—MGM Resorts International and Entain Group. You know our name through our exciting portfolio of brands including BetMGM Sportsbook, Borgata online, Party Casino and Party Poker. We aim to bring our ideas into action and find ways to deliver the best quality in gaming platforms.

We understand that each card in the deck plays a unique role in any given hand, just as our employees each play a unique role in accomplishing our goals as a company. We strive to create a culture of empathy where our employees feel valued, heard, and comfortable bringing their authentic selves to work. We want to build a product and a workplace that reflect the communities we serve so we approach our work fearlessly, take responsibility when we get it wrong, and ante-up again. We play to win, and we are all-in together.

We were recognized as one of Glassdoor’s “Best Places to Work”.

About the Role

The Casino Technical Manager will be responsible for the ongoing technical support related to online casino for the BetMGM platform, working with the Director, Casino Governance and Test Engineering to develop and implement the overall Casino Strategy and augmenting the overall Gaming Brands, that drives growth & value by being ‘best in class’, differentiated to competitors & leads the market and is as profitable as possible, including: technical integrations, features, content roadmap and launch plan & technical supplier management gaming operations and regulatory approvals.

The role is responsible for leading the technical planning and activity for products in Casino and the continued technical support of the live casino lobbies. The role will be reporting directly to the Director, Casino Governance and Test Engineering.
The performance of this role will be measured on the delivery of the new casino supplier integrations and timely resolution and reporting on any casino technical incidents and customer complaints.

Responsibilities
• Manage new casino supplier integrations and technical improvements to existing casino offerings
• Manage game and integration submissions to state regulatory bodies where online casino is applicable
• Manage and own all casino technical roadmaps, deliverables and documentation
• Deep understanding of the market, product and the customer
• Drive growth & value by being ‘best in class’, differentiated to competitors & commercially leads the market and is as profitable as possible
• Work closely with the Head of Gaming on launches and promotion schedules
• Have very strong analytical skills, work with BI to identify product and customer opportunity and create, with the team, plans to capitalize on them
• Establish a clear set of KPIs that report on & manage performance to deliver to budget plan
• Technical Operations Management of content, liaising with compliance and customers service/service ops to manage queries effectively and accurately
• Create strong technical collaboration with all Casino suppliers and provide input into their technical roadmaps based on own goals
• Supporting internal and external queries to help resolve casino related issues

Qualifications
• Bachelor’s Degree
• 3+ years of experience in a dedicated technical delivery role
• Strong interpersonal and communication skills, ability to work as part of a team
• Strong experience in SDLC
• Strong experience in development and agile principals
• Good understanding of infrastructure and cloud computing
• Experience in dealing with regulatory authorities, independent test labs and B2B customers
• Operational experience in large technology related industry
• Knowledge of online casino and gaming products
• A track record of delivering against KPIs
• Good resource planning skills
• Experience in game certification
• Excellent knowledge of the US Casino market and in particular Slot and Table Games products
• Experience managing large multi-brands gaming operations
• Strong customer-experience and product vision
• Strong technical knowledge in casino products
• Industry experience in this sector either as a casino supplier or an operator
• Strong knowledge and understanding of the gaming industry and major competitors
• Experience of working in a complex/dynamic fast paced environment is essential
• KPI, customer and results-oriented individual
• Outstanding commercial awareness and analytical skills
• Regulatory experience
• Agile delivery
• Experience in working for a multi-national organization
• Ability to communicate effectively at all levels from board level to colleague
• Excellent communication and leadership skills

About Our Culture

Building BetMGM from the ground up takes effort, energy, and teamwork, but that’s what will make leading this industry all the more satisfying. We stay focused on our main goal with the help of these four company pillars:
• Believe in Your Game – Take your shot! There’s a freedom to explore ideas usually only start-ups are lucky enough to experience.
• Backed by the Best - With our expertise—merged with that of our world-class investors—we have the opportunity to take this business, and ourselves, farther than anyone has ever imagined.
• Do What’s Right - We operate with clarity and simplicity, always doing the right thing by our customers and each other, standing shoulder to shoulder every day.
• Hustle Hard - Our combined commitment and ambition is what drives us to create some of the most innovative products in the industry.
What We Offer

As a valued employee, we’re committed to giving you the resources and support you need. We offer Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Commuter Benefits, Paid Time Off, Holidays, Employee Resource Groups and more!

Gaming Compliance

Candidate must comply with and support the company’s responsible gambling policies, procedures and initiatives.

This job description is not an exclusive or exhaustive list of duties a person in this position may be asked to perform from time to time.

BetMGM LLC is an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, sex, age, marital status, national origin, sexual orientation, citizenship status, veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. We prohibit discrimination in decisions concerning recruitment, hiring, compensation, benefits, training, termination, promotions, or any other condition of employment or career development. If your experience looks a little different from what we’ve identified and you think you’ve got what it takes, we’d love to learn more about you.

If you need assistance or accommodation with your application due to a disability, you may contact us at recruitment@betmgm.com.

Applicable salary ranges may differ across markets. Actual pay will be determined based on experience and other job-related factors permitted by law. The position is also eligible for an annual bonus.

Responsibilities: The Casino Technical Manager will be responsible for the ongoing technical support related to online casino for the BetMGM platform, working with the Director, Casino Governance and Test Engineering to develop and implement the overall Casino Strategy and augmenting the overall Gaming Brands, that drives growth & value by being ‘best in class’, differentiated to competitors & leads the market and is as profitable as possible, including: technical integrations, features, content roadmap and launch plan & technical supplier management gaming operations and regulatory approvals
The role is responsible for leading the technical planning and activity for products in Casino and the continued technical support of the live casino lobbies
The role will be reporting directly to the Director, Casino Governance and Test Engineering
The performance of this role will be measured on the delivery of the new casino supplier integrations and timely resolution and reporting on any casino technical incidents and customer complaints
Manage new casino supplier integrations and technical improvements to existing casino offerings
Manage game and integration submissions to state regulatory bodies where online casino is applicable
Manage and own all casino technical roadmaps, deliverables and documentation
Deep understanding of the market, product and the customer
Work closely with the Head of Gaming on launches and promotion schedules
Have very strong analytical skills, work with BI to identify product and customer opportunity and create, with the team, plans to capitalize on them
Establish a clear set of KPIs that report on & manage performance to deliver to budget plan
Technical Operations Management of content, liaising with compliance and customers service/service ops to manage queries effectively and accurately
Create strong technical collaboration with all Casino suppliers and provide input into their technical roadmaps based on own goals
Supporting internal and external queries to help resolve casino related issues
Benefits: We offer Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Commuter Benefits, Paid Time Off, Holidays, Employee Resource Groups and more!
Actual pay will be determined based on experience and other job-related factors permitted by law
The position is also eligible for an annual bonus

data.job_description:
About the company Albertsons Companies is at the forefront of the revolution in retail. With a fixation on innovation and building culture, our team is rallying our company around a unique vision:
forging a retail winner that is admired for national strength, deep roots in the communities we serve, and a team that has passion for food and delivering great service. Albertsons is one of the largest retail employers, providing approximately 300,000 jobs across 2,200 stores, 22 distribution centers, 20 food and beverage plants and various support offices. We operate in 34 states and the District of Columbia under the Albertsons banner, as well as Safeway, Tom Thumb, Jewel Osco, Shaw's and many more recognizable names. What you will be doing Albertsons Companies has embarked on a strategic transformation of our associate experience to provide our store employees with leveraging technologies to improve their efficiency. This role requires an experienced engineering manager with a background of applications design, development, and deployment along with handling of multiple simultaneous projects. Broad knowledge of inventory and ordering systems and its integration to Retail and Supply Chain services is a plus. Strong leadership, technical understanding, excellent communication, and ability to coach and develop your team are critical. The ideal candidate will be passionate in growing and leading the core team responsible for end-to-end project execution, application development and delivery. Retail technology is a critical component of ensuring the smooth execution and improvement for our business, which we strive to do with excellent customer service and close partnerships. The ideal candidate for this role must have a deep understanding of retail technologies, has worked in a fast-paced agile development environment and has a proven track record of leading cross-functional teams in delivering highly complex solutions. The position will report to Retail Operations Director. Members of the team may be based in Pleasanton CA, Boise ID, Vancouver, BC, India, and Manila, PH. Main responsibilities Build a high-performing team of technical professionals Software Engineers, Architects and Project Managers/Scrum Masters Develop and grow your team as they gain expertise on the new solutions and technologies Manage Vendor relationships and provide them directions to complete project on schedule and under budget Responsible for successful delivery of initiatives within the domain Collaborate with external partners to explore and research solutions, produce proof of concepts and integrate into production systems Work closely with Technology Senior Leadership to understand the business priorities and ensure the team is focusing on the right goals and objectives Responsible for managing resource constraints, addressing skill gaps, and team development Work closely with Architecture, DevOps, Infrastructure, Information Security, Technology PMO & Finance, and other Technology functions as well as key vendors/partners in implementing right solutions Drive best practices in software engineering using agile/scrum approach Effectively communicate information across multiple levels of the organization. Provide team members with an environment of learning, mentoring and staff development What we are searching for Bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent 3
years in management of technical team consisting of software engineers Ready to step in as a hands-on developer as and when needed Previous experience building system with Micro services will be a big plus Experience with Java technologies Must possess superior problem-solving skills, be action-oriented and decisive Excellent organizational skills and the ability to work under pressure to balance competing priorities in meeting business deadlines Excellent verbal, written, presentation and interpersonal communications skills Extensive creativity, drive, high energy level, and the ability to self-manage Physical Environment:
Work may be performed in a temperature-controlled environment. Must sit, stand, or walk for extended periods of time. May spend long periods of time at desk or computer terminal. Will use keyboards, telephone, and other office equipment during the course of normal workday. Work day is fast paced; some evening and weekend work may be required. What it is like at Albertsons? Albertsons Culture Principles Compassion:
We always treat each other with kindness and respect Team:
We always support and recognize each other Inclusive:
We always value everyone's perspective Learning:
We always strive to grow and develop ourselves and others Competitive:
We always act with integrity to win over the customer Ownership:
We always take actions to drive our success.

As a regional engineering manager, you would be responsible for the performance of the project team members and provide clients with high-quality deliverables on time and on budget. This is an outstanding opportunity to hold a leadership position in a growing firm utilizing entrepreneurial abilities and having your accomplishments rewarded through compensation growth and if desired stock purchase availability for ownership interest.

data.job_description:
Introduction to Shield AI

Shield AI’s mission is to protect service members and civilians with intelligent systems. Shield AI is a fast growing, venture-backed defense-technology company built around a team of proven executives, distinguished warfighters, and world-class AI engineers. Since 2018, Shield AI’s products and people have supported operations around the world with the US Department of Defense and our allies.

Are you a passionate, innovative, experienced Developer Experience Software Engineering Manager looking to help develop state-of-the-art AI and robotics products? Are you eager to make a positive difference in the world? Do you want to work alongside mission driven and values focused teammates? Shield AI is just the place for you!

As a Developer Experience Software Engineering Manager, you will build out a team and technically lead the roadmap of our internal workflows, builds, and tools. You will work closely with talented engineers to define future generations of Shield AI products by executing new programs and helping to solve the hard problems. In this role, you will collaborate closely with a variety of different engineering disciplines, including mechanical, electrical, software and AI engineering, to establish workflows to help our business grow. You will lead cross-functional product development activities to bring together our small and medium UAS systems.

As a Developer Experience Software Engineering Manager, you will:
• Drive the application of software systems to both internal and third-party consumers of Hivemind Edge
• Architect appropriate tools for users that build software into Hivemind Edge
• Help define, scope, and manage technical requirements to meet business needs
• Lead integration development between hardware, embedded, software & AI teams that contribute to easier and more efficient development
• Manage product architecture, ICD and other system level design documentation
• Be a customer facing engineering lead to support government funded development programs that use Hivemind Edge
• Contribute to government contract proposal writing

As a Software Engineering Manager on the team, you will also be responsible for:
• Aligning technical approaches with long-term roadmaps across Shield AI
• Aligning interfaces in the AI Foundations team with other teams
• Building out systems architectures and infrastructure as needed to support development efforts
• Other duties as assigned

Required qualifications:
• 10+ years of experience in Software Engineering, or equivalent engineering roles
• 3+ years of people leadership experience
• B.S. or Master’s degree in Engineering or related field
• Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
• You are organized and methodical
• You have a demonstrated record of working hard, being a trustworthy teammate, holding yourself and others to high standards, and being kind to others

#LI-AC1

$158,485 - $215,292 a year

Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, licenses and certifications, and specific work location. Information on the benefits offered is here. All offers are contingent on a cleared background check.

data.job_title: Tech Engineer / Tech Manager - MEP - Construction
data.job_description:
Overview

Technical Managers have extensive technical engineering experience, and have completed more complex, demanding or larger-value projects of various types. Technical Engineers act as technical experts for a specific discipline to insure all related construction activities are performed in accordance with accepted professional standards. They work to solve complex technical field-related problems, and manage the equipment startup and commissioning process (V-Start). They assist in the implementation of the project's 4-phase quality control plan, and monitor field construction of mechanical and / or electrical subcontractors for schedule management and conformance to contract documents.

We want you to join our team.

Through industry-leading innovation our company has forged a legacy of quality and safety since our founding in 1916.

What we offer:
• Career planning, development & growth
• Outstanding training programs

Why Walbridge:
• Large organization with award-winning projects, yet small enough for you to have an impact
• Strong values which are the foundation of our growth for over 100 years
• International, regional and local recognition for stand-out projects, safety, sustainability, culture, wellness and diversity practices

Location:

This position can be based out of any Walbridge office, or you can live in any US city if you are able to travel 100%.
Responsibilities
• Provide technical support during design and preconstruction to assist owner and Architect Engineer.
• Manage Equipment start up turnaround process V-Start (KAN-BAN)
• Assist in the implementation of the project's QC Planning and inspection process.
• Monitor Field Construction of Electrical / Mechanical subcontractors for schedule management and conformance to contract documents.
• Provide expert technical support to company personnel as required to resolve field construction or similar problems. May include interpretation of codes, design of specialty equipment, etc.
• Develop, issue and maintain general instructions and guidelines for field construction methods utilizing current industry and company practices.
• Develop and maintain current work controlling documents which set mandatory minimum requirements for work, authority, documentation and record requirements in accordance with applicable codes and contract requirements.
• Review A/E specifications, bid inquiries, etc. to insure technical and code requirements for material, equipment and field activities are met.
• Continuously research, evaluate, and recommend implementation of new (or improved) construction processes, equipment, material, techniques and methods as technology improves.
• Participate in constructability reviews of design documents to help determine most cost effective and schedule efficient method of construction.
• Manage Equipment start up and turnover process V-Start (KAN-BAN)
• Provides technical input to company functions such as estimating, controls, project management or other areas.
Qualifications
• High school diploma or equivalent. Mechanical / Electrical Engineering degrees a plus.
• Professional industry training and experience.
• Minimum of five years extensive experience related to mechanical and / or Electrical discipline. Thorough knowledge of all aspects of discipline construction technology, equipment, materials, methods, etc., required.
• Proficiency in problem solving and written/verbal communications skills essential.
• Computer literate in a wide variety of applications including web based project management systems.
• Ability to accept project assignments that may require extended long term temporary living arrangements or frequent travel to non-local job sites.

Job Competencies:
SafetyTechnical SkillsPlanning & SchedulingRisk ManagementChange ManagementQuality Control & ISOLean Understanding & ImplementationAdministration & CommunicationInnovation & TechnologyCost Participation & ControlLeadership

EEO/AA Employer M/F/D/V

Walbridge is an equal opportunity employer with a culture that promotes diversity in the workforce. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, sex, religion, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship status, status as an individual with a disability, military, or protected veteran status or any other legally protected status. We prohibit discrimination in decisions concerning career development, recruitment, hiring, compensation, benefits, training, termination, promotions, or any other condition of employment.

The Project Manager (PM) will collaborate with program manager, project leaders, resources, and stakeholders to ensure proper coordination and execution of activities related to various processes of project management, communications, budget, and data analysis.

The position assists in business planning, needs analysis, and business risk assessments.

The position requires significant interaction with cross-functional departments within the organization, experience with managing Cybersecurity projects, vendor management skills, and excellent communication and relationship management skills.
Support the programs/projects workstreams, focusing on PMO governance and project management best practices

Collaborate and team up with vendor's program managers in managing vendor's managed cybersecurity programs

Support ad-hoc project data management and report requests
Prepare materials for program reviews with leadership

Maintain library of project management templates and documentation
Held accountable and responsible delivering systems development solutions from project initiation to project closure

Experience with various project management methodologies such as Waterfall/Agile/Scrum

data.job_description:
The Role
Tesla is looking for an experienced software engineering manager to lead the Tesla Energy UI engineering team, building user interfaces that drive the worldwide transition to sustainable energy. You love delivering compelling products by leading world-class software engineers, defining engineering principles, growing engineering teams, and building a strong engineering culture. You will lead engineering of the Mobile and Web based user experiences that power our Megapack, Powerwall, Supercharger, and Autobidder products.
Our UIs are built with Typescript, React and React Native, and the Godot Engine, and are powered by our highly performant backend distributed systems. We collaborate closely with our Los Angeles Design Studio, focus on extensible design systems, and obsess over open-source quality solutions to create scalable applications. We move quickly with an emphasis on data contracts via Protocol Buffers, and aspire to always delight our users with wonderful interactions. If this sounds like your jam, we want to chat!
Learn more about the applications you would develop here: Responsibilities
• Lead the complete software development and testing lifecycle for Tesla Energy mobile and web user interface applications.
• Lead hands-on engineering using TypeScript, React, React Native, Redux, D3 Scales, WebGL, and the Godot Engine, and work with your team to define the future of the application architecture and software tools.
• Grow the UI software engineering team through hiring, mentoring engineers, and fostering leaders.
• Collaborate with product and UX leaders to define features, roadmaps, and amazing designs. Obsess over delivering beautiful, intuitive, and powerful applications for our users across the consumer, commercial, and industrial industries.
• Increase application stability and performance through unit, integration, and stress testing.
• Provide technical leadership, foster collaboration, and drive initiatives to completion.
• Maintain the values of the team which include engineering excellence, curiosity, a bias for action, self-awareness, inclusivity, and vulnerability.

Requirements
• Proven track record delivering amazing native app and/or web (preferably native app) experiences. • Experience leading software engineering teams as both a technical and people leader.
• A strong bias towards test automation and high-quality applications.
• Enthusiasm to learn quickly about renewable energy and electric vehicle systems.

data.job_description:
We're Mobilitas, a commercial insurance company created by CSAA Insurance. Our mission is to reinvent commercial insurance in the mobility space by providing technologically advanced solutions for today’s way of doing business. At Mobilitas, we believe in what's possible, we use our inventive skills to create new opportunities - we're not chasing the status quo, we're chasing a shared vision. We’re looking for motivated, innovative individuals who think big, move fast and are dedicated to creating a company from the ground up, without the constraints of a traditional insurance company. We’re excited to push the boundaries of commercial insurance and are looking for enthusiastic team members to help us reimagine insurance. We are actively hiring for an IT Manager.

Your Role: This position provides leadership and direction to technical staff supporting CSAA IG's I.T. Systems. Must achieve competency level where they can lead highly skilled technical staff. This position plays a key role in the Information Technology Systems Division's Department management team in bringing current knowledge and expertise to CSAA IG’s IT Division.

Your work:
• Working within information technology standards established by the CIO and the CSAA IG Technology organization, this position provides leadership and direction in their area of responsibility.
• Manages to departmental budget.
• Participates in development of standards and evaluates specific technologies, general technology trends, proficiencies, strategies and methodologies.
• Manages multiple and/or highly complex IT project teams.
• Leads technical efforts of project teams involving other managers and/or consultants.
• May participate in setting short-term strategic direction as well as operational policies for the I.T. Organization.
• Ultimately responsible for ensuring that Systems and Products are maintained to appropriate quality objectives and are enhanced as directed by the business community, and ultimately meet the customer service standards set by the department.

Required Experience, Education and Skills
• Ability to plan, organize and achieve coordinated objectives
• Demonstrated ability to adjust focus to meet changing priorities, alteration in strategic directions and shifting customer needs
• Ability to plan, organize and achieve coordinated objectives
• Ability to influence vendors on product/service direction and resolve significant business issues
• Accountable for ensuring effective utilization of available resources and a collaborative, team environment
• Demonstrated successful track record of managing projects of medium to large scope, complexity and budget with documented track record of success
• Demonstrated skill in conceptualizing creative technical solutions, documenting them, and communicating/selling them to senior management
• Demonstrated blend of creative problem solving and technical skills for refining existing theories and/or developing new system approaches or competency development to seize opportunities to enable business success

Electrical Engineering Manager

Location: Carol Stream, IL

Hire Type: Direct hire - $120-$140k

Overview: Join a team of experts at Sterling, a Best of Staffing company, and take your career to the next level. We are seeking an experienced Electrical Manager to oversee and manage the electrical design, development, and configuration of machines to meet customer requirements and industry standards.

Job Summary: As an Electrical Engineering Manager, you will be responsible for managing and leading a team of electrical engineers to ensure timely and cost-effective delivery of electrical designs and configurations for machines. You will be the primary point of contact for the electrical design of machines and will be responsible for managing project timelines, troubleshooting, testing, and providing support to the workshop.

Job Duties:
• Review customer RFQ specifications and define project requirements
• Provide electrical engineering recommendations and technical support
• Assist with budgeting, resource planning, and scheduling
• Manage unit and development cost estimations and determine reliable material sources
• Ensure on-time product development by collaborating with other leaders
• Streamline production while meeting compliance and safety guidelines
• Establish technical standards in documentation and designs
• Manage engineering teams and other electrical engineering staff members

Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering
• 15 years of experience in machine controls design (electrical & technical background required)
• 3 years of experience managing a team of electrical engineers
• Must have a valid Illinois driver’s license

If you are a driven and experienced Electrical Engineering Manager looking to advance your career with a dynamic and growing company, we encourage you to apply today. Sterling offers exciting work with exceptional employers across the U.S., and our expert recruiters will support you every step of the way.

Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering
15 years of experience in machine controls design (electrical & technical background required)
3 years of experience managing a team of electrical engineers
Must have a valid Illinois driver’s license

data.job_description:
Minimum qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree in Engineering, other technical field, or equivalent practical experience
• 8 years of experience in technical program management or program management (leading cross-functional projects/programs)

Preferred qualifications:
• Master's degree in Engineering or other technical field
• Experience in consumer electronics or hardware/software programs, and SoC/embedded chip bringup
• Experience in software or hardware engineering
• Experience working on embedded devices in a highly cross-functional environment where communication with multiple groups is imperative
• Experience developing process where little exists, but demonstrated flexibility to get things done
• Ability to work through ambiguity to detailed solutions

About the job

Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.

Using your extensive technical and leadership expertise, you manage projects of various size and scope, identifying future opportunities, improving processes and driving the technical directions of your programs.

The Pixel System Software team is responsible for the core software running on Pixel Phones. Our team comprises of the major software subsystems such as core bring-up, performance, power, graphics, display, sensors etc. We work closely with the hardware teams to bring up new silicon and phones, and are key to shipping our Pixel products. In this role, you will be directly involved with shaping and driving our roadmap for phones and custom silicon. You will work with cross-functional groups and drive new products to market.

The Google Pixel team focuses on designing and delivering the world's most helpful mobile experience. The team works on shaping the future of Pixel devices and services through some of the most advanced designs, techniques, products, and experiences in consumer electronics. This includes bringing together the best of Google’s artificial intelligence, software, and hardware to build global smartphones and create transformative experiences for users across the world.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $164,000-$252,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google.

• Understand technical implementation at the architecture level and propose technical alternatives when necessary. Ask questions that clarify priorities and push the team to be highly effective.
• Work closely with our leads and partners to map our roadmap.

data.job_title: Senior Engineering Manager, Protocol (Remote) (Greater Boston Area, MA)
data.job_description:
Kava Labs is a Layer 1 Blockchain company with a 100% remote and distributed workforce. We have teams located in the US, Asia-Pacific, and Europe. While distributed, you will work alongside a team of world class crypto experts on an open-source project that transfers millions of dollars in assets daily, providing the financial primitives for the next evolution in crypto.

Kava Labs is hiring for a Senior Engineering Manager, who will be 40% hands on while also managing our Protocol Engineering team, overseeing the Software Development life cycle, and planning/scoping projects in collaboration with our product and design teams. This is a North America-based, full-time, remote position.

What You Will Do.
• Manage, mentor and coach engineers: Ensure your team is meeting project timelines and deliverables. Ensure that your team follows Engineering best practices – sprints, code reviews, software design docs, or conducting post-mortems.
• Review, write and test code: Write code, review and test. Implement improvements to your team’s technical diligence. Facilitate technical design decisions and drive the team to execute against those goals on time and within scope. Ensure quality code is shipped by the team.
• Own the full SDLC: You’ll guide the Protocol team through the Planning, Requirements, Design, Building, Documenting, Testing, Deployment and ongoing maintenance of each project.
• Working Cross-Functionally: Collaborate with other department leaders from Engineering, Product and Design to execute the product life cycle.
• Communication: You’ll exhibit a high level of autonomy in ambiguous environments and are comfortable establishing and executing upon priorities with a strong sense of urgency.
• Emotional Intelligence: You’ll navigate through stressful or ambiguous situations and lead your team to continue delivering high quality software under pressure and tight deadlines.
• Innovation: You’ll identify and tackle hard problems that are considered as major bottlenecks which slow down or prevent innovation.

Who You Are.
• Minimum 5+ years in the software engineering industry.
• Minimum 1+ year experience with Web3 development (EVM or Cosmos SDK)
• Minimum + year hands-on development experience using Go or other modern programming language like Java or Rust and/or 3+ years managing a team which owned a service written in those languages
• Minimum 2+ years managing a team which owned a highly scalable service
• Prior experience managing a geographically distributed engineering team. (highly preferred)
• Lead projects and owned the relationship with Product and scoping processes from start to finish.
• Able to adapt and adjust in a high-stakes, high-growth, roll up your sleeves type of work.

Nice to Haves.
• Experience Managing a team that owned open source code/repository.
• Experience working in a Startup environment.

Interview Process.
• Recruiter: 30 Minutes
• Technical Screen: 1 Hour
• Technical Screen 2: 1 Hour
• Head of People: 30 Minutes
• Hiring Manager: 1 Hour
• Panel Screen: 30 Minutes

What We Offer.
• A fully remote work environment with an international and diverse team
• Competitive salary; including stipends for home office set-up, wellness, internet and cell phone.
• 100% coverage for Medical, Dental, Vision, LTD, STD and Basic Life insurance for employees
• 401(k) matching
• Unlimited PTO and Holidays
• A fast-paced start-up environment with experienced industry leaders

Disclaimer
Benefits, perks and policies are subject to change and eligibility may vary based on location.

About Kava Labs.

Kava Labs is focused on democratizing financial services and making them openly accessible to anyone, anywhere in the world. We started out by building the Kava blockchain, a foundational platform designed to provide the most safe, secure, and reliable experience for accessing Decentralized Financial (DeFi) apps and services. Today that platform manages over $1B in assets on behalf of users and is growing rapidly.

We are a remote-first, globally distributed team that values first principle thinking, experimentation, and learning to ensure long-term success. We are not dogmatic in our approach, but we are relentless in our pursuit to create impactful technology for the future.

We have a diverse set of backgrounds, skills, and cultures but we’re all united in our passion for building new open financial infrastructure — together so that our efforts will make a real impact and create lasting change in the world.

Our Commitment to Diversity
Kava is proudly an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. and celebrates the diversity of its growing team.

Recruitment agencies and consultants may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Kava Labs does not accept unsolicited agency resumes, and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Kava Labs.

data.job_description:
About

Macy's is proudly America's Department Store. For more than 160 years, Macy's has served generations at every stage of their lives. Customers come to us for fashion, value and celebration. Now is an exciting time to join Macy's, Inc. The face of retail is changing, and change requires innovation.

Macy's Tech provides modern tools, platforms, and services to all parts of the business. Our team supports millions of customers in connected commerce across the technology hub at Macy's Join our team to help shape the future of e-commerce and set the pace in retail technology. Whether focused on store technology, supply chain tech, application security, merchandising systems, or the mobile app - you'll have opportunities to grow your career while finding meaningful ways to make a difference.

Job Overview

The Senior Manager, Software Engineering at Macy's Technology reports to the Director, and plays a key role in leading the software engineering technical direction and integration of enterprise solutions. The Senior Manager, Software Engineering will form effective partnerships across Macy's Technology.

The Manager collaborates with various levels of stakeholders (Sr. Leadership, each department's management, project teams, Infrastructure and Field Services leaders, and enterprise architects) on architecture, requirements, and implementation of application platform features; Po ssess a combination of systems and technology experience along with strong thought leadership skill to define platform release plans that deliver key enabling features in time to support major initiatives across the enterprise; Evangelize the use of platform features in business application development across East and West Coast departments; Build and lead high performing solution architecture and engineering teams to deliver and support platform features, frameworks, and automations that provide Omni channel applications and services speed and scale; Drive platform innovation in both technology and process; Inspires the teams to achieve outstanding results in a fast paced environment.

Essential Functions
• Create roadmap and define monthly release plans.
• Lead the implementation of application services, frameworks, automations, and infrastructure that the departments, teams and their projects depend upon. Collaborate with architecture, compliance, stake holders, and PMs to estimate and plan work.
• Support department, teams and their projects on their onboarding into application and throughout their development life cycle. Work with Technical Leads, Software architects and quality assurance engineers to resolve development roadblocks.
• Evolve platform maturity in automation, operations, stability, and support.
• Communicate latest platform solutions to the enterprise through case studies, standards and best practice publications, presentations, newsletters, and town hall meetings.
• Maintain awareness of industry trends and evaluate applicability of new software tools to platform development.
• Consistently demonstrate regular, dependable attendance & punctuality.
• Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications and Competencies
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science and/or Engineering and 8-10 years of related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience; Master's Degree preferred.
• 10+ years total experience as an engineer in a Java/J2EE environment.
• 5+ years management experience of guiding multiple teams with 8-12 members.
• Deep understanding of Warehouse Management Systems
• Working in WMS space both integration and implementation
• 3+ years' experience with SOA development.
• Strong leadership profile and excellent prioritization and negotiation skills, capable of managing multiple streams of work in parallel with aggressive timelines.
• Demonstrate strong organizational and leadership capabilities, and have solid track record of leading engineering team and delivering enterprise class products. Must also have broad and deep technical understanding of the technologies in this field.
• Deep technical understanding of the technologies. The list of technology includes but not limited to: Java/J2EE, Tibco BW/BE/EMS, Active Spaces, Spark, Cassandra, Kafka, Elastic Search, Kibana, Tomcat, JBoss, stream processing, RDBMS, NoSQL databases, In-memory databases, ODS, distributed processing.
• Strong data management principles, around data architecture, modeling/design, data quality, security, data organization and operations.
• Experience in processing large amounts of data in real-time at internet scale for operational and analytic purposes.
Competencies

• Ability to effectively share technical information, communicate technical issues and solutions to all levels of business

• Able to juggle multiple projects - can identify primary and secondary objectives, prioritize time and communicate timeline to team members

• Ability and desire to take product/project ownership

• Ability to work a flexible schedule based on department and Company needs

Communication:
• Strong executive presence with ability to communicate complex messages and trade-offs and tell a compelling story; Demonstrable presentation, written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills.
• Ability to influence a diverse group of stakeholders
• Strong problem solver with ability to lead the team to push the solution and progress
• Strong leadership skills - ability to lead people and teams including giving strength-based feedback, OKR based individual development, Hands-on coaching to help the team solve complex problems.
Other Skills:
• Mathematical Skills (if applicable)
Strong technical aptitude, along with analytical skills. Advanced statistical knowledge, including experience with application of statistic to predictive analytics, probabilistic modeling, and unstructured text analysis.
• Reasoning Ability
Lead the development phase of projects, making work assignments and managing task completion. Select tools/methodologies for projects. Commit to deliverables for scope of work. Modify jobs and schedules for jobs as necessary.
• Decision Making
Decides and prioritizes the deliverables of platform components, participates and recommends the technical direction of the platform, and influences how project teams in departments develop and support dependent applications. Make management decisions, as well as make recommendations for advancement and promotions.

Physical Requirements

• Requires prolonged periods of sitting, with occasional standing

• Occasionally requires walking, bending, reaching, hearing and talking

• Continuous use of computers and other office equipment

• Frequently lift/move up to 10 lbs

Travel Requirements

Travel Required Occasionally

Engineering Molded Plastics - Detroit, MI

Engineering Manager Plastic Contract Injection Molding Process Manufacturing Engineer Applications Sales Support Proposals Process Tooling Development _ .

This Hands-on mangement position will be responsible for all engineering related activities for an injection molded plastic component manufacturer, assembler, and packager. Ensure product designs, modifications and support activities are completed on time and under budget, and meet customer specifications.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
• * Work with product specifications to develop component and assembly geometry, specify materials and establish acceptable performance standards.
• * Establish injection mold cycles, define pre- and post-molded product processes.
• * Prepare or assign engineering change requests, engineering change notices, bills of material, engineering specifications, and customer submittals.
• * Direct the construction and testing of prototype and pilot products, and conduct analysis and verification of results.
• * Drive failure modes, effects analyses (FMEAs) and design reviews.
• * Provide leadership and training within Engineering group to accomplish the company goals and objectives, and instill a cross-functional team concept.
• * Drive projects to completion on-time and on-budget.
• * Collaborate with Product Management to ensure that optimal product performance, specifications, features and data are clearly communicated.
• * Interface directly with shop employees to clarify questions on drawings and designs.
• * Assist with troubleshooting production issues.
• * Define processes utilizing best practices while driving continuous improvement.

Requirements include a BS degree in a technical field, and a minimum of 5 years in a plastics manufacturing environment. Must have a technical understanding of injection molding process, including Scientific Molding, Mold Flow Analysis, and Process Controls.

Company offers a high visibility opportunity with a wide career path. Benefits package provides paid family leave, holidays and vacation time, 401K and FSA savings plans, choice of healthcare plans, life insurance and continuing education assistance.

Define processes utilizing best practices while driving continuous improvement
Benefits: Benefits package provides paid family leave, holidays and vacation time, 401K and FSA savings plans, choice of healthcare plans, life insurance and continuing education assistance
Salary Range: $90,000 to $160,000

data.job_description:
At Wells Fargo, we are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who embrace diversity, equity and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and inspired. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.
Learn more about the career areas and lines of business at wellsfargojobs.com .
About this role:
Wells Fargo is seeking a Software Engineering Manager as part of technology in Commercial and Corporate & Investment Banking Technology (CCIBT) within the Transformation Digitization (TD) to manage the rapidly growing Intelligent Automation RPA team. We automate processes for the commercial banking group to increase efficiencies and reduce risks with our advanced automation software.

In this role, you will:
• Manage a team of individual contributor senior and lead engineers
• Ensure the craftsmanship, security, availability, resilience, and scalability of solutions developed by the teams or third party providers
• Engage in mentoring and guiding the professional and technical development of more experienced engineers
• Identify and recommend opportunities for developing product functional and technical strategies for the domains, as well as the development of actionable short and long-term product roadmaps, by partnering with business product managers, lead systems architects, and more experienced engineers
• Make decisions and resolve issues regarding strategic products of engineering teams to meet business objectives
• Oversee engineering teams to deliver commitments aligned to strategic product priorities
• Interpret and develop security, stability, and scalability within key areas of technology risk
• Collaborate and consult with agile teams and product managers to drive outcomes
• Interact directly with third party vendors and technology service providers
• Manage allocation of people and financial resources for technology engineering
• Mentor and guide talent development of direct reports and assist in hiring talent
Required Qualifications:
• 4+ years of Software Engineering experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education
• 4+ years of Intelligent Automation RPA experience
• 2+ years of Leadership experience
Desired Qualifications:
• Experience with Blue Prism and UiPath
• Banking or Financial Services Experience
• An industry-standard technology certification
• Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills Expectations:
• Ability to work onsite at the posted location Posting Locations:
• 1525 W WT Harris Blvd., Charlotte, NC 28262 We Value Diversity
At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, individuals with disabilities, pregnancy, marital status, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law.
Employees support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business unit's risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements.
Candidates applying to job openings posted in US: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
Candidates applying to job openings posted in Canada: Applications for employment are encouraged from all qualified candidates, including women, persons with disabilities, aboriginal peoples and visible minorities. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available upon request in connection with the recruitment process.
